Reviews.Title: “took a chance and was quite happy”
Reviews.Author: jeaNewYork
Reviews.Content: Took a chance (based in trip advisor recommendations) on this hotel and was very happy with our choice. Most of the staff was quite nice and helpful. Breakfast (included was sufficient-my biggest problem was the coffe was never hot in the morning) I hate warm coffee. Great location, loved being off Las Ramblas close enough to get there but far enough away fromt he craziness of the street. Metro was an minute walk from the hotel and it was quite nice during the day and the end of the day to sit on the rooftop and look out on the harbor. Bathroom was not great, had trouble with the shower and getting enough towels everyday I had to ask (6 days). Hated asking for ice everyday as well. All in all was a great vacation, was there with my 16year old daughter and we had a blast! Highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel within walking distance of great areas”
Reviews.Author: Gabalotte
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for two nights during Semana Santa.A perfect location for walking around ,Ramblas,Gotic,Born,Barcelonetta etc.very helpful and friendly staff too. The breakfasts were good,served ,in a charming dining -room.Rooms very quiet and clean ,nice ,modern bathrooms with fluffy towels. Would have liked to have had tea and coffee facilities in the room and also a few more drawers though.Unfortunately it was too cold to take advantage of the roof terrace bar and pool but it looked super.Would recommend this hotel,we left it to the last minute and got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “We really like this place”
Reviews.Author: Orbitspaw
Reviews.Content: The good experience starts with a warm greeting at the reception desk. They even give you a glass of sparkling wine. Our room was on the back side of the hotel. It is very comfortably sized and spotlessly clean. Many reviews mention the rooftop area. It was too cold for us to enjoy this but went up and enjoyed the view of the Barcelona waterfront. There is a very small swimming pool that would be nice on a wsarm summer day or evening. The Gothic Disrict which is located behing the hotel has numerous interesting bars and restaurants. Should you spend more than a day or two in Barcelona I strongly suggest that you purchase a Barcelona Card. You will get ulimited local transportation as well as free and discounted admission to many area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location......”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHacc
Reviews.Content: But a boring street. The Gothic area is in the back of the hotel and a really lovely area :) Hotel habourfront, nice view and superior room on 5th. floor. Cleaning could improve, due to wool carpets in room gets dirty. Breakfast nice, but same warm dishes every day.....Have a new menu every weekday, then guest will not be bored. All in all we had a nice trip and enjoyed Hotel Duquesa da Cardona.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarieDub
Reviews.Content: I can not compliment this hotel enough. Have just returned from a short break staying there with my family. Location is perfect for , staff are so helpful Naomi, David and Josey on the front desk could not have done enough to make our stay enjoyable. We had a junior suite which was excellent and extremely spacious. Breakfeast was included in our rate and this certainly set us up for the day !

Reviews.Title: “Luxuriously Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Judy5464
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not over the top but does everything very well. The rooms are very clean and simply designed. We had a room facing the main street (Colom) and an interior room on the first floor and they were both insulated from street noise. The location was wonderful and near tons of great places to eat and shop...walking distance to Ramblas and the mercatos.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: petitbidou
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel in a great location. I enjoyed a very friendly welcome by Lluis and liked the general decor and atmosphere of the hotel. The room was well equiped, comfortable and full of little attentions. I would definitel stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveK1957
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Duquesa de Cardona Hotel in August 2011 while visiting Barcelona. We had a Junior Suite which is really two rooms combined with the wall removed. It was very spacious and comfortable. Our adult children (18 and 21) stayed on the pull out sofa which was very comfortable and we also had a single bed brought in. The Hotel was very clean and well maintained and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We were able to book our tickets to most of the attractions that we visited right at the Hotel. We had a room on the second floor toward the back of the Hotel, and the only complaint we had was about the noise that comes from the bar directly under the Hotel. It was very loud until 2:30AM and then it was fine. We asked to be moved and the staff moved us to the fifth floor which helped somewhat with the noise. We quickly got into a rythym of staying up until 2:30AM and sleeping until 9:30AM and then getting on our way by 10:00AM. The Hotel is located a block from the waterfront and you can easily walk to a large number of attractions and restaurants. We spent about 4 full days touring the city on the hop-on, hop-off buses. There are two different routes (green and orange) which take you across the entire city. There is just so much to see and experience. This is the best way to see the city. We hit most of the must-see attractions including: - la Sagrada Familia - Casa Batllo - Palau Guell - Guell Park - L'Eixample District - Picasso Museum - Las Ramblas - Gaudi House Museum - Olympic Stadium - Nou Camp (home of Barcelona Soccer) just to name a few. My wife is an Architect, so she was really amazed by all the Gaudi architecture. We had a wonderful time during our trip. Barcelona is an amazing city. I only wish we had more than a week to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Location excellent, Staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: QuentinH
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suit/family room, two rooms in one (wall removed) great room for a family. (Only minor problem which all hotels get wrong for familys- (except a couple of Disney hotels) Is a curtain/screen to get the children to sleep You can switch half the lights off(Half the room) which was good. Very helpful staff. Good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Pichito
Reviews.Content: We stay at the duquesa de cardona a month ago and we had a really good experience. This place is really good allocated just a walking distance of all the places. Room are well decorated and the service is quite eficience expecially recepcion staff. We wil recomended this place to everyone visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, lobby misleading cause rooms and rest are the best!”
Reviews.Author: tfu555
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Very nice and friendly hotel. Lobby does not promise much but when you get to the rooms you get the feeling it is a good one!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: MarmoraMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Barcelona early on Friday morning - following an overnight sleeper journey from Paris. The hotel were welcoming at 09.00 despite our book in time being, notionally, 15.00. We were allowed to store our baggage with the hotel and offered a room to brush up and freshen ourselves before setting out to explore Barcelona. The hotel took my mobile number to call us once our room was ready. Our room was large with an equally large bathroom. Very clean with a well stocked mini bar and a comfortable bed. It was in the front overlooking the Marina on Passeige Colom. It was incredibly quiet with double, double glazing. The view was great and, despite the extreme cold, the boulevard was used to walk dogs and children, cycle, roller skate, skate board and generally promenade. In the summer this would be an amazing spectacle. Breakfast was generous (but, regrettably, no tostada & tomato). Staff were very helpful - booking taxis and recommending local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Orla B
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in fantastic location. Overlooking port and minutes walk from ramblas and attractions. Stayed in junior suite for 3 nights and was given beautiful room with complimentary bottle of champagne in the room when we arrived. So pleased to have booked this hotel over all the others. A visit to Cal Pep restaurant 5 mins away is a must! Very clean hotel with lovely breakfast & no noise complaints at all . I would not stay anywhere else but here if returning to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 29cah
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was recommended by Alaisdar Sawday and also because the price was very good. I emailed the night before to let them know we would be arriving after eight in the evening and requested either a king size bed or twins. We were advised that we had only booked a classic room which was double or twin, fair enough, so we were happy with twins. On arrival the lovely receptionist remembered my email and had found us a bigger bed! The room was lovely fresh and clean with a good size bathroom, big towels and bathrobes, chocolate on the pillow, weather forecast and even a choice of air freshener. Full bar and big tv that had a few English channels. We had a view of the main street, there was a little noise but not excessive. Out side our room was a lovely sitting area with lots of books to read. We could have moved in for a long holiday but we only had two nights. The staff were all very helpful and cheerful, we did not once feel we were in anyway ripped off! We did not eat at the hotel as we wanted to explore, but had tea and coffee one morning which we thought was tasteless and cold, the only negative in our stay. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stefanok
Reviews.Content: I am a hard man to please but this hotel has managed to impress me beyond belief. Where do I start? Think of a beautiful building within minutes walk of everything you could need- restaurants, bars, shops, main gothic attractions etc. Then combine these attributes with massive, spotless, quiet rooms, incredibly friendly staff, great buffet breakfasts, an impressive roof terrace overlooking the marina (sadly unused owing to arctic temperatures) & good quality wifi. Could anything be better? Yes, how bout having all of that for 85 euros including breakfast. I will definitely go back. I want to try their other hotel in France.

Reviews.Title: “Sevice”
Reviews.Author: Saverio D
Reviews.Content: We stay at the duquesa de cardona a few months ago and we find this place amazing. The situation is so convenience just arround of everything. And the staff was so so professional and ready to help any time you need any information about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd stay at this hotel and hopefully not our last!!”
Reviews.Author: kazza029
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long wknd 20th Jan - 23rd Jan, after having stayed there last year. The hotel is ideally located for Las Ramblas, the port,and the Maremagnum. The staff are most helpful and greet you from the moment you step out of the taxi.Our room wasn't ready as we arrived early, so they store your luggage in the luggage room, and it is then waiting for you in your room when you get back.The rooms are of a good size and we had nice views, and a good sized bathroom.If you want anything ie, toothpaste,razor etc just ask at reception and they will bring it to your room.The breakfast is plentiful and a good choice, and we ate in their restuarant last year and was again very good and reasonable. The views from the roof top terrace are amazing, and I would love to go back in the summer and chill and enjoy a cocktail up there.This is our 8th visit to Barcelona and we love this city, so much to see and do and the shopping is amazing.There are so many hotels to choose from, but if you find a good one why not go back? We hope to see all the staff at the Duquesa De Cardona again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault”
Reviews.Author: dionne1155
Reviews.Content: I booked this for my daughters 21st as i had also booked to see alicia keyes in barcelona the hotel was on the main road but no road noise was heard from the beautifull hotel room it was very close to everything write opposite the marina and around the corner from the main strip of clubs and restaurants the roof terrace and pool were lovely and there was a bar also

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem”
Reviews.Author: VIEQUESBEACHBUM
Reviews.Content: the roof top bar and pool are the best. We sat up there both nightssmokes wonderful Cuban Cigars and watched the lights around the marina. with a short walk of all the great restaurants and shops in old town. The rooms arent the best, but this place has a "small luxury hotels of the world" atmosphere. Would stay here again in the Summer

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: FRANCISCO P
Reviews.Content: Excellent location Good decoration Good Room Good Bed and matress

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Masterzarco
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience to stay in a place nearby everywhere i love it

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosemarieSurrey
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel, situated near to the old gothic quarter (Cathedral) and a short stroll from La Ramblas, overlooking the marina. The bedroom with small balcony was lovely (no noise at all with double double glazing) and superb bathroom - everything spotlessly clean and excellent service. Plenty of choice for breakfast set in a beautiful room. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a short break in Barcelona. We got the two day touristic bus pass which allowed us to visit all the main tourist attractions (hop on hop off) and found some lovely places to eat - one outside the museum and one in a lovely square behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: TGandDG
Reviews.Content: Took an interior room to avoid street noise issues knowing that we had access to the floor deck with a pool and lounge. Had problems with noise coming from the 6th floor lounge but went quiet around midnight. On our last day/night we were told that a function was in the lounge and deck area so it would be inaccessible to us but we could have a bottle of sparkling wine on the house. We asked and were told that the function would end at around 11PM. We stayed out ‘till after midnight to avoid problems and the party was still going LOUD and strong when we returned to our room. We complained in very strong terms to the front desk and about a half hour later the noise quieted. When we asked to get the manager on the phone, he almost choked. "It's late and he's probably sleeping." was the response - We said "Exactly - that's what we want to do." We spoke to the manager on checkout and he took care of the problem with us. Room size was adequate. Again, the beds were very comfortable. Products were OK but Spartan. Breakfasts were like Meninas in Madrid but less selection, adequate but not replenished as the morning progressed. Well located on the harbor a short walk to the beach and a short walk to the Shopping, tapas bars and restaurants. A long walk (or short cab ride) to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooftop terrace bar!”
Reviews.Author: misskyo
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the hotel. We were keen on having a few drinks after our lovely tapas dinner so we googled and found this place. Nice cocktails, staff and wonderful views over the port. Would be even more romantic had I been with my boyfriend lol. I would recommend this bar to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beatifull Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taksin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Barcelona last month and I was very happy with my acomodation. This hotel is very beautiful, incredible views and all the staff are really nice.the room was confortable and clean.If I come back to Barcelona I will choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with many other reviewers...”
Reviews.Author: afa20816
Reviews.Content: Great location, breakfast very good and rooftop bar a delight, especially the view at night. Must agree with other travelers however about the noise on the alley to the left as you face the harbor and also the size of the room/bed. Bathroom very spacious (read: a waste of space) taking up too much of the sq footage, room and bed tiny for two average size adults. Location excellent for visiting many of the sights but again must emphasize choosing a room with a high floor at the front of the building. Wish we had asked to be moved.

Reviews.Title: “Like the hotel watch the noise”
Reviews.Author: B100Bwb
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel,but the noise from the rear alley is an issue.ensure you get a front facing room and ask for a high floor. The rear rooms get all the noise from the adjoining alley. This was a real issue with noise throughout the night.the hotel was great but i would not book again in a rear facing room

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel in an ideal situation”
Reviews.Author: M.R.Carr
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 nights in Barcelona and were very pleased that we chose this hotel.They kindly upgraded us to a harbour facing room which was really quiet.The situation is perfect for exploring the main parts of the city, as well as the harbour area.It is also close to a couple of the stops of the excellent 'Bus Turistic' city tour which ran every 5-10 minutes. The breakfast was extremely good.Our only complaint was rather low water pressure in the bathroom, otherwise a first class hotel with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service! They ripped us off $$$$$.”
Reviews.Author: Skittleslover
Reviews.Content: We recently booked this hotel through a booking company. In the process, the search engine reverted back to a 'default date', and not the date we needed the room. We never even stayed there, as the date they reserved was before we even left the USA! We advised the booking company, who phoned the hotel several times in effort to refund our money (as the hotel was now sold out for the dates we needed it). The hotel repeatedly refused to refund our money. In fact, the manager wouldn't even return the phone call to the booking company, and responded only with an email stating he could do nothing for us. And, the rate they charged to our credit card was double the rate they had advertised as 'on special'.

Reviews.Title: “Quality value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Richard Q
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at the Duquesa 11/11/2011 to 17/11/2011. Cant not really find fault, with the hotel or the service. The staff could not do enough to help at any time. The location of the hotel is perfect for visiting the various quarters of Barcelona, it overlooks the marina / port, you go left out the door and your heading in the Gothic area and zoo, turn right your going to the La Ramba area. Cross the road, and your in the marina / port area, aquarium etc. Good quality fresh breakfast ( we booked b/b ) you can pay at the hotel, the old saying you get what you pay for, suggest book breakfast when booking the hotel. It not to large hotel but not to small either, we had a deluxe room, view over the marina. Very important they had double, double glazing so kept the noise out, trust me its a noisy city, without sound proofing you would not get much sleep and we were on the 5th floor, and you could not here the people in the next room either. So there you have it, if back in Barcelona only one place to stay for us..... R Quinn

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, including loud bars”
Reviews.Author: trvlr5
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant boutique hotel that suffers from being next door to a racous cheap booze bar. The rooms are great, lovely roof top deck, great breakfast and it's close to everything you want to see. BUT, it's on a very busy street with equally active nightlife. Might not be with springing for the Harbour view if you want quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, lovely roof, however small dark room”
Reviews.Author: cbroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Duquesa for a long weekend trip from NYC last April. We were so excited to escape cold Manhattan for sunny Barcelona and to utilize the terrace, specifically the small pool. We were thrilled with the location of the hotel, steps from the Gothic Quarter and La Rambla. However, the room we were given was very small and lacked character. The only window we had looked out into the dark vestibule of the building. We had hoped for something a little more charming. Since we didn't plan on spending too much time in the room anyhow we headed to the terrace. We were completely disappointed to see that the pool would be out of service the weekend we were there...and not only that, they decided to stain the wooden flooring on the terrace making the entire roof deck area essentially closed. When the main amenities offered by a hotel will be compromised, I don't see why they wouldn't have alerted us before we arrived, in case we wanted to look for a hotel that did have a working pool or terrace. We could have gone to the W, or any other number of places. Or, perhaps Hotel Duquesa should have offered an upgraded to a more comfortable room or a dinner, or something to make up for the inconvenience. We were charged full price and offered no such consolation. On our last day, we asked at the front desk for a recommendation to a good Paella restaurant. The concierge gave a recommendation and said he would call and make us a reservation, and then leave a confirmation of the time on our room voice mail. When we returned we had no message, so we called down to inquire about the reservation. He said we had a reservation at 9pm. Sadly, when we arrived at the restaurant they had no reservation for us. We had to wait over an hour for a table that we were told would be reserved. All and all Hotel Duquesa dropped the ball in many areas, and when we returned home I responded to their inquiry to see how our stay was. I mentioned the flaws, and how I was disappointed to have paid full price to not be able to use the main attractions of the hotel. They apologised and offered nothing further. What is even the point of asking how your customers stay was if you are not going to be responsive to criticism?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful positioning, helpful staff but some odd quirks”
Reviews.Author: Hanna D
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely weekend at this hotel and overall were very satisfied. It was wonderfully positioned and we enjoyed having such easy access to the Port Vell and the Ramblas. The roof terrace is a treat so do take time to have a drink at least up there. We booked with the three day offer on the hotel website which was very good value but the first room we were given was rather pokey and disappointing. The staff were very accommodating however and when I asked whether we had been allocated this room because we had benefitted from the offer and explained that we were rather disappointed, they moved us to a much bigger room on the front of the hotel the next day which we much appreciated. The only problem with this room was that we could not open the windows because the noise was deafening because of the huge amount of traffic in front of the hotel and we were so very hot that we had to put the air conditioning on (in late October!). In fact we found that the hotel was generally overheated which might be a plus for some. Another curious observation - in the small room there was a very comfortable massive double bed whereas in the large room, the two single beds pushed together were each barely large enough for a normal sized adult - again odd and this made sleep much less comfortable. The breakfast buffet was great though the coffee was not freshly made odd once again for such a good quality hotel in other ways. That said the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel despite some rather strange quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing,amazing ,amazing”
Reviews.Author: f00dmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends at the end of september,you know things are going to be good when you get a glass of champagne while you book in.The hotel is situated overlooking the marina and right next to the Gothic quarter,so you are very central yet in a quieter area. The hotel is small but we thought beautifully decorated and calm,with a great roof terrace bar overlooking the marina ,where you can watch the cruise liners come and go and chill out while drinking gin and tonics or cocktails before heading out at night to one of the dozens of restaurants close by,you will be spoilt for choice.Having stayed in the noisier place de catalunya area before i much preferred this part of the city,and so close to the fabulous beaches .Great staff and service,and lovely rooms and breakfast ,what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel: good location.”
Reviews.Author: m0ntesansavin0
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite as a bit of luxury. The room was in fact two singles knocked into one rather fully designed as a suite. Thus it had two bathrooms and two safes. It was spacious with a large and comfortable bed. Different pillows were available if you wanted them but the ones provided were good. There was a sofa table chairs etc, a large TV and in short the room was well equipped. The (two) bathrooms had both shower and bath. Plenty of soaps and good shower gels were provided. In short , a very comfortable room which was well decorated in muted colours. There were two small balconies overlooking the narrow street behind the hotel and there was no view except into the guest hour opposite. I didn't mind that as the bar on the top floor has good views over the harbour which sells food and wine until 0130 hrs. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming and any questions were well handled and their advice on nearby restaurants reliable. I don't want to put anyone off staying in this hotel which is highly recommend by me, but from my room on the 4th floor you could hear the shouts and screams of the revellers in the nearby bars. Impossible to avoid in reality so bring earplugs like I did and you will sleep very soundly, as I did. Only one minor complaint but at breakfast the scrambled eggs which were cooked at maybe 0700 and left to harden in a warmer were not at all nice. But you could order fried/boiled eggs instead. Otherwise breakfast was good. The hamburger which I ate on the top floor was really good, as was the wine I had with it. The hotel located by the harbour is very convenient to all the locations that as a tourist you want to go. Wifi was free and fast enough for my needs. Great place! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jack M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Duquesa de Cardona in Barcelona and my stay was really great. The location is perfect and we were also able to enjoy the city thanks to the help of the staff. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved this Hotel.....will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: hsmia81
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 5 nights in a Deluxe Room (thank you for the upgrade) and absolutely loved it. Nice beautiful room. Modern, clean and very comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to everything, from Las Ramblas to the Gothic quarters. I can just highly recommend this hotel and will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wilson66London
Reviews.Content: A relay super hotel, stayed there with my wife a week ago, a perfect plac to come back to after visiting beautiful Barcelona and sites such Sagrada familia and the Ramblas Staff were very helpful and rooms very well appointed , I would highly recommend to other travellers to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmaranzana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Duquesa de Cardona, for a couple of nights during my trip in Barcelona , this summer . It was absolutely wonderful . I liked the waterfront location and at the same time you can stroll into the old medieval streets of the gothic quarter , right behind the hotel . The Duquesa is a gorgeous boutique hotel, very well appointed . I like the rooftop terrace , and the breakfast was of excellent quality . It is a member of the Boutiqe hotel collection called Epoque Hotels . The Manager Cristina , is very welcoming and affable .

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, on arrival we were upgraded to an amazing suite with a lovely harbour views and a bottle of bubbly. We were definitely made to feel special. The staff were all really helpful and polite. The roof terrace was a real treat, we ate there a couple of times and couldn't fault the food or service - the views on an evening from there are lovely too. The hotel is really well placed for getting around Barcelona - you can easily walk to the beach and you are on the doorstep of metro station or the main tourist areas. We would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money”
Reviews.Author: doktorduck
Reviews.Content: Got a very good rate including breakfast on their website. Made a mistake concerning the numbers of persons arriving (marked "1" while we were 2 indeed) and sent a mail. Very fast and polite response that there was no problem and the price was the same. Very friendly staff, no problems at check-in and check-out. Room was quite spacious and had a nice view onto the beachfront. With windows closed no problems with noise, although there is main road in front of the hotel. Location ideal for shopping, lots of restaurants within some minutes of walking. As our flight departed in the evening, we could drop our luggage at the reception and made use of the loungers on the roof terrace. Would like to return any time, only thing that was not up to standards was the breakfast, not bad but not as sumptious as I´m used from other hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond on our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: narroyo11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what a 4 star hotel should be. From the moment we got there, to the moment we left, they were extremely accommodating to our needs. The room itself was very clean, the shower pressure was great, and the bed was very comfortable. The location was great - mostly because it was close enough to La Rambla, without being too touristy. Our room faced the water, and we had a great view. The rooftop deck put this hotel is really what added the special touch, as we were able to have sangria and wine before we went out to dinner and after we came home. So great - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: victoriamason
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and lovely and cool as we got there in temps of 36 and 90 per cent humidity. We were grateful for the tranquil haven which it most definately was . The views from the rooftop bar which we frequented on the 3 nights we were there are breathtaking and the location is just right for everything and not far to the beach also. The bar staff were really friendly and the gin and tonics are excellent the best I have had and the extra touches count. The only negative was the breakfast which was advertised as American Buffett which it was not. Just a nornal continental breakfast which was not over exciting. The room we were given was also dark but the bathrooms are well lit which is the main thing . Overall a very good experience and would go there again but not in August because it was just too humid.

Reviews.Title: “A little hotel to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: linda S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location to visit Barcelona , you will be able to walk to the old part of the city, the Ramblas, and the port. We stayed in a junior suite 21 and we loved it! Good size room and beautiful decor. THe hotel was very little, that must be one of the reason ways it was so easy to feel that comfortable and get so much contact with their staff, who taked care of us all the time. Good restaurant area at the port for spanish food ( try merendero de la mari, barceloneta ) but also the roof terrace of the hotel, where the barbecue options are very decent for the price the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maurdunn
Reviews.Content: Fab location , helpful staff. Comfy rooms. Swimming pool ridiculously tiny but roof terrace delightful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Itchy_feet1978_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Duquesa de Cardona for 3 nights and returned home today. We had a fantastic stay. The pool and roof terrrace is great and we spent lots of time there. Cocktails are delicious if not a little on the highly priced side. The location is great. 5 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and close to lots of nice bars and restaurants. Beaufiful little streets behind the hotel are full of tapas bars and little shops. The breakfast was a little too delicious and we ate too much every morning! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Barcelona and we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel in a Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Anne1761
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend spent at the Hotel Duquesa de Cardona. A gem of a hotel with a lovely roof terrace bar and restaurant with spectacular views overlooking the harbour. Very close to Las Ramblas and behind the hotel is a maze of cobbled streets with many bars and tapas restaurants. The staff are very friendly and left a bottle of cava chilling with chocolate truffles in the room on my husband's birthday, what a lovely gesture, we would recommend this hotel and wll definitely return to Barcelona and wouldnt hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Sheri24_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located across from the harbor, aquarium, and Imax theatre. Five minutes walk to La Rambla, ten minutes to the beach. Phenomenal staff. Comfortable rooms (extremely quiet). Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: taja22
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable - close to Las Ramblas, without all the noise, and close to a bunch of little boutiques and restaurants on the alleys between the Cathedral and the waterfront. Staff was very helpful - after check in, we realized there was only one bed, and we were able to request and receive a room with two beds right away. Rooftop bar is cool, but pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: davenrich
Reviews.Content: Really cute hotel with an ideal location. Loved the roof top bar! Views were incredible, especially at night. Our room was adequate in size, a bit dark and not as charming as the photos...but immaculate. Breakfast was yummy too. The BUT is because they messed up on our reservations. We reserved two rooms for two nights and only one room was reserved for ONE night. Luckily, they were able to find one other room for our friends for the first night and then they had to move all four of us to a sister hotel about one block away for the second night. They were extremely apologetic and moved all our luggage and to the second hotel themselves. The other hotel was very nice but it was still very disappointing. I would stay here again but confirm and reconfirm my reservations!! p.s. Thank you to the staff for being so nice through all that!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Janet R
Reviews.Content: Reserved 2 rooms for 4 nights for two couples. One included breakfast - identified on room card BB (bed and Breakfast). When this couple went to have breakfast, they were told to pay. They explained they had breakfast included and the server told them they did not, argued and insisted on payment 3 separate times during breakfast in front of all other guests. Finally, the server told the couple to speak to the front desk (before the could even finish breakfast), the wife told the front desk they had prepaid breakfast and it was on their room car folder upstairs - she was told to go and get it. She did. She was then told the card was wrong! BB was written on the wrong guest card. The wife explained it didn't matter because they were accompanying the couple in the other room and both rooms were under her name and paid by her - but Naomi told her that didn't matter. The couple finally requested to speak to the manager. He apologized and offered both couples breakfast the next day. The next day the husband of the additional couple presented himself for breakfast compliments of the manager - her was told to pay, went to the front desk, to Namoi, and she told him he was to pay. The manager came out and apologized, said he'd told the personnel to provide breakfast for all and to disregard these employees, but when the couples returned to their rooms, their keys no longer worked - so they had to go to the front desk to ask Naomi for help when they wanted in their room. Upon leaving, Naomi, front desk, tried to collect for the breakfast once again! First, it was highly embarrassing to be approached 3 times during breakfast in front of all other guests. Second, it was unprofessional to blame the guests if BB was written on the wrong card! The customer had paid for both rooms and both were under her name - there was never any dispute she'd paid for 2 breakfasts - she was told she couldn't apply the two to the paid breakfast! What a fiasco!!! And we can all only surmise there is some control issue Naomi has with the manager - obviously neither she or the woman overseeing breakfast have any respect for him whatsoever. Rooms were pleasant enough, on the small side, but the experience with personnel ruined the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: BaileyToronto
Reviews.Content: High praise for this hotel and its staff specifically Marta and Luis. We arrived early after an overnight flight and Marta made us feel welcome and worked to accommodate our early arrival. She suggested a quick walk through the city to get us orientated and when we return the rooms would be ready. The rooftop patio and bar/lounge was excellent with attentive staff, sufficient towels and an adequate pool for getting cooled off. The prices for mixed drinks are a bit steep with a drink costing $10 euros however portions are large. Rooms were well appointed and the hotel was relatively quiet despite being located on a busy street. The hotel is situated close to the beach and the gothic area therefore making the location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “small luxury hotel in the old town”
Reviews.Author: jglaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the old town on a boulevard facing the marina and harbour. Nice 16 century building with a wonderfull rooftop terrace and bar wich overlooks the harbour. We had a the luxe room with small balcony, located on the boulevard side for better views. Expect some street noise. Interior of the hotel is boutique style. From the hotel you walk right into the carfree historical center.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is superb”
Reviews.Author: henrikta
Reviews.Content: Superb location with nice clean rooms. Perfect service and reasonable price. Will be back!,,

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTourist2008
Reviews.Content: More five star than five star. Impeccable decor and service. In every possible way exceeded my high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: gd1973
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel enough. Beautiful. Lovely, friendly service. Great rooms. Perfectly clean. Spacious. Perfect location. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: POSitiveBrett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Barcelona the day before our scheduled Mediterranean Cruise and stayed at Hotel Duquesa de Cardona because of its location close to the port. We were pleasantly surprised at the level of comfort and style the hotel offers... comparable to some of the boutique hotels we have enjoyed in New York City, Sydney, and other world class cities. We enjoyed great service, nice accommodations, and a fantastic walk down La Rambla, which is just a block or so away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ! Great location ! Amazing Roof Terrace!!!!”
Reviews.Author: louisewerkmeister
Reviews.Content: Just come back from four nights at this hotel with my mum. What can i say ? ? When I booked we were told that the rooms at the back were more quiet, good advice. The hotel was in a busy but great location opposite the port and next to the Old City. The room was clean and modern and the staff were brilliant, thank you. The bar terrace and pool was the highlight!! Great for an afternoon in the sun after shopping and for a late night drink! Breakfast was ok and could have a little more choice for hot food, but all in all one of the best hotel i have stayed in, and def will be coming back, on my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: keithandnancy
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our luxury break in this "Conde Nast 4-star ","Alistair Sawday special place" hotel. At euros 240 a night (inc cont bfast) we expected something quite special."You can safely expect the best of everything here" The "harbour-view" room(43) was a very ordinary twin with 6 lanes between the hotel & the harbour. A youth hostel is just round the corner in the same block and rowdy football enthusiasts entertained us till 2 am.The room had practically no drawer storeage for clothes, and a remote which didnt work the TV --even after reporting it to reception; the "stunning bathroom" had just a shower into a bath & always sprayed all over the floor . On 2 out of 4 days the room still had not been made up by 3pm.The first time we complained but the room was still not cleaned at all that day.The beds were rock hard.Management seemed non-existent and we rarely saw smiles on the receptionists faces.The "fine restaurant" was closed for the week.The wi-fi creaky. This austere, soulless hotel is overpriced and at 4-stars over-rated. It needs a professional hotelier to get to grips with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, surly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jinjawitch
Reviews.Content: There are elements about this hotel that can not be knocked; the view from the rooftoop terrace, the proximity to Barri Gotic and the building itself. Nevertheless, I was less than satisfied with the whole experience. My friend emailed ahead to reserve a room higher up in the building and a twin room. I'm unsure whether it was due to incompetence or bloody-mindedness, but after waiting twenty minutes in reception for service on our arrival, we were given the lowest room in the hotel. The room was tiny and dingy and not at all worth the rather inflated prices that they charge. The receptionist claimed that was the only room available in the hotel but after arguing for a while, magically conjured up another on the fifth floor. This was nice enough (although it was dirty when they gave it to us), but with a double bed. We were not able to change rooms for the duration of our stay and were given a bottle of Cava to appease us (we had requested a discount). I have spent a lot of time in Spain and, although rusty, I understand the language fairly well. This helped when translating the rather loud argument the barman and maid were having on the rooftop and the griping the maid was muttering when I asked her for a towel. We once made the mistake of asking the barman for a towel, and he claimed he didn't do towels and stalked off in a huff. We were left hunting for another member of staff as he made no attempt to help us. Thoroughly unpleasant, rude and unhelpful. Oh, and the card keys never work.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great second visit”
Reviews.Author: AmyEade
Reviews.Content: This could be an amazing hotel. The location is excellent and beautiful.One of the few hotels to overlook the water at the front but has the twisty lanes of the shops and bars of the Barri Gotic straight behind. A 10 min walk to La Ramblas or 15 to the beach on either side. I had enjoyed a stay here 4 years ago so made an early (prepaid) booking for myself and friend for a girls weekend away. I checked my twin bed booking with the hotel two weeks before arrival and asked for a room on a high floor. I did stress we were friends and liked our space. I received a email agreeing to both and stated that the classic rooms were all 25m. On arrival (15 mins, E30 by taxi from airport) we were given room 14. Ground floor at the bottom of a tiny internal courtyard. My friend described it as a dungeon. It was the smallest darkest room I have ever seen and certainly not 25m. Why would you give a returning guest such a poor room? The receptionist said it was the only room available. We said we were leaving .He then found a room on the fifth floor (54) but with a double bed.The next day the only room we could change to was on the third floor so we stayed put. The rooms need a bit of a sprucing up although we saw carpet being put in so maybe it's being done. There's no drawer space ,tea/coffee facilities or chocolate on the pillow.On the third day they put a bottle of Cava in the room for our troubles but this was only because we had complained a lot. We went to the Hotel 1898 for a drink as this would have been our second choice. The location was not as good but the level of service and attention to detail totally outshone the Duquesa. The waiter insisted on changing my cocktail when he noticed I wasn't drinking it and there were blankets, patio heaters and free nibbles brought out with our terrace drinks. The staff at the Duquesa had to be tracked down all the time and did the minimum expected only bringing things if asked- for example pool towels and chair cushions for the outdoor seating. Breakfast was included and whilst not much of a choice was OK. Coffee was horrid though and the buffet is set up in a totally awkward corner so you have lots of guests bumping into each other. Having said that the location is the best with the charming bars literally behind the hotel and some fantastic places to eat. There's a place next to Sensqui(?) that has a E16 set dinner menu that is fantastic. I might stay again because of location alone but do make sure you don't pay more than E150 a night because it's not good value.Other guests are all very nice and are a slightly older, well heeled bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Neil186225
Reviews.Content: Harbour view room very comfortable and initial problem with aircon was resolved instantly. We got the impression that nothing was too much trouble for the staff and that customer service was paramount. Ideally located out of the bustle of the city centre and within easy walking distance of great quality restaurants. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: hq014
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 27th March - 1st April 2011 to celebrate my 60th Birthday. The Hotel is beautiful, the rooms clean & quiet (could do with more draw space), the breakfasts are plentiful & the staff charming, friendly & polite. The location is wonderful, perfect for a first time visitor ready to explore the lovely city of Barcelona. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples & families. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel superb location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: len1112
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with very friendly and helpful staff, a pity that the season was to young for a swim on the rooftop, a good reason to go back again in the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Well run comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: quantockm
Reviews.Content: Near the marina and a short walk from the old town, this hotel is well positioned for a short break. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms comfortable and ours at the rear very quiet. Rooftop terrace and bar has excellent views over the port but out of season it was a bit difficult to get service. Good breakfast and if you can get a a special rate for room and breakfast, the hotel is fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: rammell
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel. Negatives: afternoon coffee is free BUT be careful not to take any cake or you'll be charged for it (€6). No evening restaurant service (at least, not at the time we went). Slow bar/snack service. Breakfast variable - for example, I pointed out one morning that the scrambled egg was cold. Whilst they offered to cook me fresh scrammbled egg (good), they did nothing about the fact that the "hot" food tray was sitting in a bain-marie of cold water (bad). When my "freshly cooked" egg arrived, it had black bits in and appeared to be re-heated egg. No English-speaking TV channels. Positives: good location for tourist locations. Free wi-fi internet. Lazy breakfasts. Good size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for getting to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Moonmanc59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a haven in a busy city. It is certainly ideally situated for getting to all the attractions you wish to see. It is down near the marina at the bottom of La Ramblas, so as long as you like walking its good place to stay. We had a standard room at the front of the hotel overlooking the main road and the marina, whilst it is a main road and has a lot of traffic you do have the benfit of double glazing so the trafffic noise is not an issue. Our room was large, clean and tastefully decorated. The Hotel is very comfortable and very welcoming. The staff are all helpful and anything you requested or needed was never to much for them to do for you. The buffet breakfast's accommodated everyone's taste and what we liked was that it was served from 7.00 until 10.30 -great if you dont like getting up to early. The only criticism is that they did not clean the rooms until mid to late afternoon, but in their defence we did request that they cleaned it earlier in the day which they did. Overall very impressed with Hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Josecorpes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duquesa De Cardona is a great boutique hotel located in the heart of the city. It was beautiful, clean, the rooftop area was extremely nice, the rooms were big and the staff was amazing. I also recommend visiting Montserrat!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: joolsmac
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Duquesa. The staff are great and very pleasant. It was my birthday during our stay and the flowers my husband ordered beforehand were waiting for me in the room - and the receptionist wished me a happy birthday on checking in! Our room was lovely - very comfortable beds and not noisy at all, despite overlooking the street and busy road. The roof terrace is perfect for a lazy afternoon drink - fantastic views across the harbour. The location is perfect for all the main sites - 5 mins to La Rambla and loads of fantatsic restaurants nearby. Around 15 mins leisurely walk to the beach and Barceloneta. Will defo be back!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel/very close to port”
Reviews.Author: selos10
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel one day before and one day after the cruise. wheeled the luggage over to catch the port bus (E$2) that dropped us off by the cruise terminal. You can catch the blue bus that is parked parallel to the double decker hop on hop off bus(BARCELONA BUS TURISTIC) right across from cristopher columbus monument Can do the same thing once the ship returns to port! hotel is very nice/clean/modern and offered a good rate. walk to Ramblas/Bari Gotic. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small and intimate”
Reviews.Author: erliverpool
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Cardona. It's in a fantastic location - equal distance between the old port, marinas and the sightseeing of the old quarter. Lots of windy, narrow streets just behind the hotel, buzzing with life and we always felt perfectly safe. The hotel is quite small and friendly. We found the reception to be perfectly friendly and helpful - especially when they stored our bags on the Sunday and didn't object to our returning several times throughout the day to add or remove items. The room was on the small side and rather dark, though very comfortable. Strangely the bathroom was almost as large as the bedroom and was very luxurious. The hotel was very quiet, we never heard any room noise. Breakfast was excellent - typically continental, but a varied choice. The only negative was that we would have liked fresh coffee rather than the large thermos flasks which cooled rapidly. The open pool on the top floor is little more than a bath tub, but lovely views from the rooftop although the bar was empty when we visited. We'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ideal location”
Reviews.Author: macker59
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great location for a holiday in Barcelona.From the moment the staff greet you at the door you know you are in good hands.The rooms are spotless and a very good size,separate bath and shower which I Iike and ask for a quiet one.Pool on roof with snack bar is good,with a lovely view over marina.Plenty of nice places to eat within 5 mins walk.Will stay again when next back in lovely Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mpfund
Reviews.Content: Stayed her 3 nights mid-October. Great location on the water, near La Rambla. Street just behind hotel full of fun tapas restaurants. Front desk employees gave great restaurant recs. Stayed in a superior room and were quite pleased. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite boutique hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: carlossaga
Reviews.Content: A Modern hotel with a relaxing atmosphere, very good location and a greatly attentive and effective service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, Beautiful Hotel, Great Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kitti25
Reviews.Content: Amazing Stay, Beautiful Hotel, Great Location and friendly staff. I had an amazing holiday in Barcelona with my Mom. We celebrated her 50th Birthday and therefore we got an upgrade for free of charge from the Hotel. The room was big, quite, and beautiful. It was amazing, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eat here!”
Reviews.Author: Djento
Reviews.Content: Ok,it's a good hotel with a very good location,but what no-one seems to mention is that they have an excellent restaurant,especially when you can eat at the rooftopterrace.They don't have an extensive menu,it's more tapas style,so order several dishes,you won't be disappointed.Very nice dishes,original combinations,great taste and good quality.Great value for your money,5 à 7 dishes,a bottle of wine and coffee takes between 70 and 90 euro's for 2 persons.Better than the overrated prices at the palau de mar in the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Average - large room size lost by smell that lingered in room”
Reviews.Author: dssrriri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short 5 - 7 minute walk from the bottom of La Rambla. Gave us the luxury of ending our nights very late and feeling safe walking back to the hotel. Easy walk to the tourist bus stop at the base of La Rambla and short walk to the Barcelonetta beach too. The only good thing about this hotel turned out to be the location. We got a very oversized room with 2 bathrooms, which very functionally great, however, the room smelled of a wet, rotten carpet and complaints yielded answers from staff that 'its a part of life'. Being a boutique hotel, the lobby in non chalant and there's no concierge. It was hard to get service after 7 pm as only one person was manning the front desk with no support. Breakfast (included) was average and no hot foot (eggs, omlettes) were offered up. We learned you ask for it and it will be cooked inside the kitchen and brought to you. There is a rooftop seating and a very small wading pool. Eating here had an extra service charge as food had to be brought up from the kitchen in the first floor. Also, there are 2 very noisy bars at the bottom of the hotel facing the Barri Gothic area....at night the noise levels were high, and the partying continued through 2-3 am everyday. The room rates very not too expensive considering Western Europe in summer. Overall, I would stay here again.....Le Meridian is on La Rambla and costs about the same - modern hotel with modern services....Duquesa was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “very poor service and smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: tea-usha
Reviews.Content: we stayed for two nights at Duquesa, and quite frankly that was too long, I couldn't wait to leave. There was no welcome or friendly face at reception, rooms that should be clean smelt of stale smoke, not good for anyone let alone a non smoker...Swimming pool should be described as a kids paddling pool very very small. Poor service at the bar and the internet did not work and the staff did not seem to care or show and interest to get it fixed. This was not the relaxed holiday that we had planned and did not live up to the expectations of the website not worth the money..definetly would not describe this as a four star hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: InternationalLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just a few nights in Barcelona, unfortunately the staff were very rude and unfriendly on arrival, the rooms smelt of smoke... even the non-smoking rooms! The noise levels at the front of the building were quite loud. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel, and there were no staff management working in the evenings. The internet did not work and the shower was broken, we stayed for 2 nights and had to change rooms 3 times! Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki123
Reviews.Content: We arrived home yesterday from a 4 day Stay at the duquesa de cardona hotel and absolutley loved it! We got a taxi from Barcelona Airport to the front of the hotel which cost 25 euros, the taxi driver was lovely warning us to be careful of pick pockets in las ramblas and to make sure we ate along the sea front, especially the fresh fish! The hotel was lovely, The best location, Right in front of you you have the harbour, which is just in front of the beach, the beach is a 15-20 min walk from the hotel, but well worth it! Much busier beach than we expected too! The reception staff were friendly and the hotel has a real air of class! To the right of the hotel you have 'Las Ramblas' which is just a 5 min walk. It has a huge food market, lots of places to eat and lots of street performers to see! Well worth a look. We took the Barcleona tour bus from just outside the hotel (The right and head to the roundabout) which cost 29 euros for 48 hours - Well worth doing as you get to see the entire city. The views from the duquesa de cardona roof top are amazing - they look right over the harbour and to the beach in the distance, the pool is very small, but cosy and most of our stay the roof terrace wasnt very busy, so having it to yourself is very romantic. The rooms and the hotel are very, very clean, the beds and towels changed daily! Fab service! The bar was quite expensive, so make sure you as for a menu before ordering - The resturant at the roof terrace was always quite busy at lunchtime, we only ate one meal which wasnt very nice - but we saw some meals that looked ok, so possibly worth a shot. The resturant staff seem to work quite hard, but there is a lack of organisation, possibly due to them being understaffed? So as nice as they were, when ordering food/room service expect a wait! We waited 45 minutes for toast and tea one morning, despite being told it would be 10 minutes!! The only other bad thing about this hotel was the noise from the street below, We were unlucky enough to have roadworks from 8am all day, so no chance of opening your balcony door, even without the road works the traffic from the busy road below was loud enough! The noise at night is also quite load, drunk people singin etc.... but when you put the location into persepective, i would easily stay there again despite the noise! We were on the 3rd floor and didnt stay at a weekend mind, so maybe it would be worse if you were lower down and there on a Saturday night?! Overall, despite a few bad points, it is a lovely hotel and i look forward to returning one day! Thank you Duquesa de cardona for making our stay in Barcelona fab!

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointing”
Reviews.Author: stijnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the hotel. The rooms are clean, nicely furnished, we had a junior suite with our 2 kids of 3 and 4 years old. From the first night on we slept very bad due to the noise in the backstreet although we specifically asked for a room at the back as I read some comments about the noise of the frontrooms. It was hardly bareable as it was till 4 AM, we complained to reception the first night but were told the noise was normal and mostly at weekends so it would get better ... it didn't. After a few nights we complained again and somebody from maintenance checked the window: it was broken and was fixed the same day. For us this is not acceptable for this level of hotel. We got cava and some chocolates from the hotel which was friendly but too late. The matrasses on the beds are way to hard, even the pillows didn't charm us, at 10 PM it was not possible to get another pillow as housekeeping was gone home? Breakfast was included but not ok for a 4 star level, the breakfast staff is very poor, tables are not cleaned fast enough, buffet is not refilled on time, I felt like kicking their ... sometimes. Swimming pool is ok but small, loved the hot water though for the kids. The views over Port Vell and harbour are stunning. In general our stay was quite disappointing, the service not always very professional, although the reception staff was friendly and most of them ok. I would rate this hotel max 3 stars and feel ripped off if I compare price/quality, it's a shame ...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel on a perfect loaction”
Reviews.Author: MATYL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not far from the ramblas and there are very good tapas bar in the neighbourhood. The hotelstaff is very helpfull. The rooms are spacious and clean. The breakfast is also more as enough......

Reviews.Title: “2 star not 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDoneThat01
Reviews.Content: We specifically requested a non-smoking room and were told upon checking in that we had been given one. The smell of cigarette smoke during the night and in the morning were overpowering. We went down to complain and were told by a different staff member that the non smoking floor was one above ours. We had been lied to and were told we had been given a non-smoking room. The room was spacious but had an old bed spread and thread bare carpet on the floor. Lobby small and dated looking. Bathroom was large and modern. Right beside a youth hostel with 2 beggers on the street and a good 15 minue walk to Las Ramblas. Breakfast was poor -soggy eggs and luke warm coffee so we stuck to the yogurt and croissants which were fine, do not eat at the hotel . We switched to Hotel 1898 right in the heart of Las Ramblas which was a fantatic, modern hotel which all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: cwagsg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Duquesa at around midnight and received a warm welcome from Rodrigo at reception. Check-in was quick and easy. Our room was on the 5th floor with a harbour view and was delightful! A comfortable size and good sized bathroom. We booked the romantic package, so when we arrived at the room there was a nice bottle of chilled Cava waiting for us, along with chocolate dipped strawberries, a single rose and rose pettles on just about every surface - it was superb value for money! Breakfast offers a small buffet of hot and cold items and is more than ample to get you ready for a busy day sightseeing. The rooftop terrace was lovely to chill out and enjoy the view. There are a few sun loungers and towels are provided. The bar service wasn't great and Spirits (Gin, Vodka etc.. we're totaly overpriced, wine was v.reasonable), but the terrace is a lovely space to spend some time. Most importantly the hotel is spotless in all areas. If you are taking the sightseeing tour, I would recommend taking an early bus from Plaza Catalunya (about a 20-30 minute walk) to avoid long queues. A one day ticket cost €24. We also took the Montjuic cable car, the views were amazing. The location of the hotel couldn't be better, lovely views over the marina, 5 minute walk to the Christopher Columbus statue at the foot of La Rambla, about 20-30 mins walk to Plaza Catalunya and about 20 minute stroll to the beaches at Barceloneta. We also walked to Sagrada Familia which took about 45 mins / 1 hour. Will definitely recommend the Duequesa de Cardona and would definitely stay again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location, Fantastic Room & Great Terrace”
Reviews.Author: WorthKnowing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night in this hotel whilst in Barcelona for the weekend. The hotel is situated in a fantastic location, in easy walking distance to all the major hot spots, or easily reached by metro which is a 1 minute walk from the hotel. After an easy check-in, we used the pool and outdoor terrace which has a fantastic view over the marina. Our room was spacious with king size bed and two exceptionally clean bathrooms! One major draw back is the street noise. We stayed on a Saturday night and the noise from underneath and neat y clubs/bars was enough to keep us away till the early hours of the morning. Upon registering our disappointment with reception, the following morning, we were told that it is "a common problem" albeit the room was double glazed.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything and good for Families”
Reviews.Author: RJR13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - walk to beach, lots of restaurants, on edge of old town, near zoo, aquarium and parks. We spent four nights with two young children. Visit was great. Room was spacious and comfortable (two bathrooms), but a little dated. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooftop deck is great for a drink and great view of harbor although the rooftop "pool" is more like a bathtub. Breakfast was good but very overpriced and breakfast room had plastic patio chairs to sit in. Save your money and visit one of the many bakeries in nearby Barri Gotic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MariaBCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duquesa for a little over a week to both celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary and attend a Green Day concert in Sep/Oct 2009 . The hotel building was very pretty and the staff was always friendly and helpful. The location was perfect - right across the street from Port Vell and less than a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas. The hotel is close to tourist buses, cabs and the subway and there were many restaurants within walking distance. The hotel's rooftop bar is also perfect - a perfect place to drink sangria while watching the marina and all the night life out on the street below. Should you need Internet access, they also provided free Internet service inside the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to others and would not hesitate to return here myself.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel - a few details missing.”
Reviews.Author: G0East
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a girls' week in Barcelona. Overall a very good hotel - would go there again. However, some things that could be improved .. - If you are a light sleeper and book a room facing the harbour be prepared to hear some noise through the windows at night. Nice view but this is the downside. - Ask for a non-smoking room if you want one. I first had a smoking room as I had not specifically asked for it. - Reception staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Some other staff members, however, we did not find very attentive - e.g. a waiter at breakfast or the maid not replacing tissues in the bathroom. Little things, all in all, therefore still a recommended place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Duquesa!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGal67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a terrific 6-night stay at the lovely Hotel Duquesa de Cardona. We were in a Classic Room, which had adequate space for the two of us. The bathroom was large, with both a walk-in shower and a tub with shower. Everything was spotless, clean and fresh. The staff were very courteous and attentive, particularly Noemi at the front desk. She greeted us and confirmed our requested preferences, all of which were honoured. There is a lovely 6th floor terrace which we were able to enjoy on one of the warmer days. There is also a small “business corner”, complete with computer and printer, which is free to use. We received our wake-up calls as requested, as well as our ride to the airport. The hotel is on the palm tree-lined Passeig de Colom, overlooking the marina. There are several restaurants, shops and tourist sites within walking distance, as well as subway stations for easy transportation. We definitely recommend the Duquesa to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A nice enough hotel - shame about the nightlife”
Reviews.Author: wockwabbit
Reviews.Content: A beautifully located hotel with terrace views over Port Vell. The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. The room was quietly understated and had a lovely bathroom. My only negative point was that our room backed over a nightclub or something equally noisy and with no double glasing we were kept awake each night (until we bought earplugs) by people leaving and the staff emptying the collected bottles at 3am. We would happily go there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderul stay.”
Reviews.Author: calamityj65
Reviews.Content: Highly recomendable. The room was spottless clean, Breakfast excellent. In the heart of the Gothic quarter. Will surley stay there again. Quality and price excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and well-appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoebe226
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to couples 30 yrs old and up or business travelers. It is not a "party" hotel. It is elegant and comfortable. We had a room with a balcony facing the marina, which was lovely. The bed was super comfortable and the room was modern. The roof had a lounge area which served food and drinks, and also had a "small" pool. The views from the rooftop were great to sit and enjoy a glass of wine. We didn't eat at the restaurant b/c we slept in everyday and missed breakfast (!) and went out every night for dinner, so I can't comment on the food, but the restaurant was very attractive and modern looking. The location of the hotel was also good. It was a few blocks from La Rambla, across the street from the marina and close to "old Barcelona"; which was fun to explore and found a lot of delicious restaurants. This hotel was perfect to come home to after a day of running around sight-seeing. It was quiet, comfortable, and clean. I should note that the room was "large" compared to the usual european-sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meotin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night before our cruise and chose the hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. The room was really nice at the front of the hotel with a small balcony. We had no problems with noise once the window was closed and it was well worth the extra. We ate at a small tapas place around the corner but came back to sit on the rooftop terrace. It was a lovely evening and a very relaxing place to watch the world go by. The staff were brilliant and could'nt do enough for us. It is in an ideal location to explore the gothic quarter and Las Ramblas . We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Barcelona. Thank you to everyone for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Location - Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelDe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location: the hotel is located on a very busy street - Passeig Colom - which runs between the marina and the Gothic quarter (the old city). It is about a 5 minute walk from the Plaza Colom, where you can pick up the Bus Touristic. This is also the bottom of Las Ramblas. It is about a 10-15 minute walk from Barcoloneta and the beach. The location is a good base for sightseeing - you can easily walk to the marina, beach, Las Ramblas, and even Plaza Catalunya. The metro and Bus Touristic are very close. However - given that the street is very noisy and busy - be very careful about what room you get! Room Location: We had a room facing the street on the 2nd floor. The location of the room was terrible. The noise from the street was heard at all hours of the night, so if you want to get some sleep after sightseeing, book an interior room or a deluxe room on the highest floor (5th floor?). I had to wear ear plugs to get some sleep - and mind you, I have lived in NYC and Washington, DC, so I know what it is like to live in a city. Rooms: The rooms themselves are very spacious (even by US standards). Our room was nice with a real king size bed - not 2 twins pushed together. And the bathroom was large and nice. However, be careful of the A/C. One morning we woke up to the awful smell of cigarrettes, which seemed to be coming through the A/C vents or ducts. Not sure exactly how, but it smelled as if someone was smoking in our room and was pretty disgusting. Rooftop Terrace: The rooftop terrace is nice, especially for a late night drink with a view. The view is nice of the marina and sea but no view of the city. The pool is tiny and not worth it in my opinion. Staff: The reception and hotel staff were friendly. However, they were not very well prepared. We asked about Bus Touristic tickets and they said that they can be purchased at the hotel reception. We went the next morning and apparently the hotel had run out of tickets. This isn't a big deal, since you can buy the tickets on the bus or at an info booth, however, it was just a little annoying. All in all, the hotel is nice, clean, modern with a "boutique" feel. Just be very careful about room location if you want to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jorgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the hottest and most humid week for a long time. The A/C wasn't working properly when we arrived and with one phone call the maintenance guy was up and fixed it within an hour. I wouldn't bother with any of the restaurants on the same street as the hotel. We tried a couple and we thought the food was average and expensive. Try the numerous ones down the side streets. The room was a good size by European standards. Bed was comfortable, bathroom BIG and we didn't suffer any noise problems. We faced the harbour on 4th floor - room 40. Rooftop bar and restaurant were great and it wasn't until the last night we discovered the delights of sitting there watching the sunset (from behind) and the light change over the harbour. My only "complaint" is I couldn't get my MAC connected to the WIFI - but my wife was pleased. I didn't bother to ask the staff to help. Would stay here again, but to be fair, would probably try another hotel in another area - just for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Way too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: chicagomomchicago
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel in an excellent location, but if you value your sleep, this is not the place to stay. There is very loud street noise going on until at least 4 a.m. We complained and asked for a quieter room, and was told that there were no quieter rooms except for some very small interior rooms which would not accommodate the three of us. The charges for breakfast and wireless internet access were both excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, roof terrace glorious views”
Reviews.Author: travellerdavid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights - couldn't have wished for a better location. On the waterfront but easily close to the old city. The roof top plunge pool ideal for cooling off in the afternoon, combined with a view over the old harbour and the opporunity to people watch- what could be better. Don't bother with payong the (extortionate) charge for breakfast on the terrace. Rooms were very well furnished - staff excellent and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaBTorontoON
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, very close both to the beach and to the Gothic Quarter/ Las Rambla. Staff was very helpful and friendly and room was elegant and clean. Also, dipping pool on the rooftop and free internet. A. Bertolone, Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin1Eire
Reviews.Content: I got married in Barcelona and we used this hotel as our base. Some of our family and friends also stayed with us. The hotel was quite pricey but well worth it, I have stayed in numerous hotels in Barcelona at the same price and they were definitely not worth it. We found the staff at Duquesa Cardona extremely friendly and helpful. The bar and roof terrace is open to the public so friends / visitors were more than welcome to join us. The terrace is really lovely, I have stayed in several hotels in Barcelona that advertised roof terraces - this was by far the best! the pool isn't huge but enough to cool off. Great views over the harbour area. The rooms were small but great views from the rooms at the front of the hotel and reasonable sound proofed, rooms at the back are very quiet but no view :( The hotel is also in a excellant location, 5 mins to El Born - the old area of the city which has lovely restaurants & Bars. It is also only 10 mins to Las Ramblas & beach. Breakfast is good, all the usual and loads of it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona location, good atmosphere, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Trond-Oslo
Reviews.Content: Great view from the top terrace. We stayed there as much as we could. Very small pool, but it does the job on a hot day. Only 6 sun chairs, but we never had problems grabbing a couple of them when that was what we were after. The roof top also have a couple of comfortable sofas were we enjoyed some good Cava's (that were reasonably priced). Order your bottle right away, since the service is slow, and the waiter obviously has to visit the cellar to get it. We had a junior suite facing the narrow back street. We booked last minute, so did not even ask for a sea facing room. Next time we will. Stayed for 3 nights. The location is perfect for exploring different areas in Barcelona, and take a break at the hotel in between. We paid 225 Euros for the 4 of us.
