The junior suite was obviously 2 rooms that was permanently transferred into one. Plus: 2 spacious bathrooms that is very good with two teenagers in the family. Minus; 2 double beds, one of them extremely large but the other one a little to small. Very convenient but expensive underground parking just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Waterfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adele028
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights following our cruise. I had a lovely room overlooking the waterfront, my daughter, son-in-law and grandson had a larger room in the back of the building, and were "treated" the first night in to a strip tease from the apartment across. The staff are all very helpful and friendly, all speak English very well. I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, and the fact it has a roof-top pool/lounge/waterfront view. Out of the 3 nights we were there, 2 nights we were not allowed to go to the roof top because the hotel had booked private functions. So, that was a disappointment to us. The staff was very accommodating, our cruise arrived early morning but the rooms typically are not ready until early afteroon. They held all our luggage in a secure area, then transferred them up for us when we returned from our walk across to the Aquarium, the 2nd largest in Europe and very enjoyable. The beach is about a 20 minute walk - be aware if travelling with young children that many people like to sunbathe "au naturel". Las Ramblas is very close by, we walked all the way up to Rambla Catalunya, about a two-hour leisurely stroll one way, but very busy and interesting to navigate with a stroller. If a quiet hotel is important to you, this might not be the best choice. The hotel is located on a busy avenue and sirens - police and ambulances - are a constant. Add to that the younger crowd from the hostel a couple of doors down enjoying themselves at the sidewalk restaurant right next door, it can get noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: comfortfun
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with very friendly staff. Location is perfect!! The marina is just across the road. We had 2 rooms in a private area which is great for a family. The main room had a balcony to the front - perfect! - Very clean - really great breakfast!! (good value) - some fabulous CAKE!! :) Lovely pool area on top with GREAT views. Parking across the road - very handy. The Ramblas is disappointing. The zoo was well worth a visit - dolphin show especially! Barcelona itself isn't the cleanest of cities :(

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ArbroathRedlichtie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights and can thoroughly recommend the Duquesa de Cardona. The room was more than adequate and the location was ideal for sightseeing.Less than a five minute walk takes you to the terminal for the tourist bus and there are ample restaurants/cafes within walking distance.The rooftop terrace is another big plus giving you a birds- eye view over the Port area.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient location for this quaint little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lilbunnyinmoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Barcelona on June 16th-19th after spending a week in Mallorca. We were uncertain where to stay since we were traveling with friends who had already booked at the Arts Hotel. Now as we look back on the trip we are glad we stayed at the unpretentious Duquesa and not the snooty Arts. Our friends had such a long walk just to get to our hotel let alone explore the city. We simply walked out of our hotel and quickly turned down an alley and we were off an adventure. Hotel- Although this hotel is nothing fancy, doesn't have a large lobby, or many amenities it is very well situated. It is only blocks from La Rambla, it's at the edge of Barrio Gotico, close to the beach, and near the Born District. The view of the port from the roof-top pool and bar area is not to be missed. Not to mention we were thankful not to be looking just at walls or people's laundry from the roof. Location does matter if you want to escape the hustle of the central part of town. There are tons and tons of little restaurants hidden down all the alleys. That's the best part because is it doesn't take long to find some great food! We found a little gem called Sensi at Carre Ample 26 just a couple blocks from the hotel. The food, wine, and ambience are fantastic!! The staff- Very helpful and they all speak English, but I would certainly do some research for restaurants prior to leaving because the ones they recommend are not good! A little effort and you can find some delightful places very close to the hotel that are not tourist traps. Pool/Bar- The view of all the boats on the port is the best! The pool is tiny and they do not have many loungers so plan a head if this matters to you. We had spent a week laying out in Mallorca so it wasn't a priority for us. The drinks are decent, but the service is a little spotty as you sometimes had to wait for someone to come up from the restaurant. Depending on the drink you order most are around 6 Euros which is a fantastic deal compared to the 16 Euros per drink you pay at the Arts. Yikes! Restaurant- Sorry to say but we never tried it because there are too many yummy places outside the hotel. Rooms- We did not have a "room with a view" to say the least. It was facing an interior wall, but I will say it was very quiet- which is a bonus in a noisy city like Barca. **One thing I need to mention as a note of warning if you visit during the summer or anytime during warm weather BEWARE the room you are in might have a horrible smell. We were in room 59 and every afternoon we returned to an absolutely foul odor that permeated the entire room. The hotel is aware of this and even gave us a room deodorizing machine to little avail it still smelled awful. Never mind if that's all I had to complain about cause I wasn't about to let this ruin a fab trip to Barca!!! You don't go to Barcelona to stay in your room. Despite our stinky room (hopefully they will fix this) we will be back to the Duquesa de Cardona in the future. This time I think we'll splurge for bit nicer room though. lol :)

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and lovely hotel across from the Marina and a few blocks to La Rambla.”
Reviews.Author: debdeb7
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if you like the waterfront and Marina view. It was a much more quiet location than hotels located on La Rambla like the Monte Carlo or Majestic. Be prepared to walk about 3 blocks to the main waterfront area and lower La Rambla. We also enjoyed the location as we were able to explore the Gothic quarter right behind the hotel. I recommend you look for restaurants in the gothic area just off La Rambla to save a few dollars. We also enjoyed an Irish Pub a few blocks behind the hotel. The rooms were good size for European standards, comfy beds and good size bathrooms. Coffee on the terrace was a fun way to start the day. Ask for American style coffee or you will recieve expresso. I loved Barcelona and if I were to go back I probably would have stayed closer to Plaza Catalunya. But if you are looking for peace and quiet and you do not like crowds I would recommend the Duquesta de Cardona as a peaceful alternative. We traveled with another couple and our rooms were next to each other on the 5th floor Bay View.

Reviews.Title: “63 euros per night for a 4* hotel! Check their website for current deals!”
Reviews.Author: Queen1000
Reviews.Content: The Duquesa de Cardona is a pretty 4* hotel in a great location for Barcelona sightseeing. We went in late March for 3 nights, and their website offered rooms at 63 euros per night, including tax. Our room usually goes for over 200 euros per night! Check the Duquesa de Cardona website, not any consolidator, in case you want to change your room/nights - no problem when you reserve directly with the hotel. We changed room types like 3 times! (blush). We finally decided to go with the lowest price, instead of the harbor view. And we were well satisfied. We liked our room, #35, alot. All marble bathroom, separate shower and bath, a little balcony on a narrow street looking onto another building with other courtyard windows, a queen bed, about 12 ft ceilings. The room was narrow, but felt pretty spacious because of the ceilings. Flat screen TV, 2 fluffy bathrobes and slippers, shampoo & body lotion (no hair conditioner). It was quiet at night. It's not as large and grand looking as the website photos seem, but is still a pretty hotel. They have a restaurant (we didn't try it) & room service, either in your room or in the rooftop pool area. The rooftop pool has a stunning view of the harbor and city, a full 180 degrees, and is very nicely decorated with plants, also has the large standing heaters for chilly or rainy nights (it's colder in the north of Spain), which the staff will light for you if you request at the front desk. Since it was March, we often had the rooftop to ourselves at night. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Metro and statue of Christopher Columbus, which is the beginning of Las Ramblas, the famous streets in Barcelona where there is shopping, street entertainers, baby chick selling, shell games, and pickpockets. That's right, I said pickpockets. Thieves are sadly rampant in the tourist areas of Barcelona, which is where the hotel is conveniently located. We were robbed in the Sants metro station by a "nice" man asking a question, while his co-hort stole a small suitcase in back of us. The Duquesa de Cardona made an appointment with a police supervisor, after my husband insisted. But we really got nowhere. The hotel staff sadly admitted that petty thievery is a big problem in the 100% tourist areas, like certain metros and Las Ramblas and the quaint Gothic quarter. Unlike Madrid, where we had just visited, there is not a mix of indigenous Spaniards going to work, living in the area, etc - it's just us tourists, so the thieves have easy pickings. My advice: DON'T be nice to any unknown person(s) asking questions or talking to you at all, hold your bag & valuables near, say No, no, and walk on. Although there were 5 or so persons before this incident that asked me perfectly innocent questions, it's not worth getting the one person who doesn't. Thank god our passports weren't in there! My husband overheard another guest in the Duquesa de Cardona also talking about being robbed! And this is only a 40 room hotel. Most persons in the hotel are foreigners, not from Spain, so don't worry about not speaking Spanish, the staff handles English easily, and probably other languages (but I wasn't particularly listening, since I was practicing my Spanish and going into English when I got confused). All the staff really tried hard to please us. When I asked for extra towels, it was brought to the room immediately. The same for room service of hot tea and wine, and I asked for something else to be brought to the room (can't remember what). All was done immediately, you could see how much they want to satisfy you. One of the hotel staff recommended a tapas restaurant to us, Lonja de Tapas, which we went to since it was close by. But it turned out to be expensive (46 euros for drinks & tapas, $61 USD), even though I had specified that we were looking for inexpensive tapas, and even though the hotel had given us a money-off brochure for 2 free drinks. So I wouldn't take the hotel's word for it again on any other restaurants. They wanted to call & make a reservation for us, even though when we got there, the place was empty & actively trying to inveigle people to stop in. So I believe this is just the staff's way of getting free food for themselves later on by way of referrals. We had better luck just looking at menus with good prices as we walked around. The food in Barcelona, at the 5 or so places we visited, was outstanding & creative - different from Madrid - especially if you like aioli which they used to flavor many items (garlic mayonnaise mixture). A very good price at current bargain website rates (check their homepage), for a lovely & conveniently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: lizclassic54
Reviews.Content: We paid 180 Euro for three nights room only (through EPOQUE hotels) Had a great time despite the rain and the location was perfect. Stayed in another hotel for two nights that was also 4 star but was very poor in comparison! I an very picky but was very pleased with the whole feel of the hotel and its staff

Reviews.Title: “If this suits your budget, Book It! Superb value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Duncman007
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was the best choice we made in Barcelona. We spent way too long looking at hotels on the internet and it's almost impossible unless you already know the layout of where you're heading to. So in my opinion, unless you have 5 star money to spend this hotel is a winner. Just so you read this in the right context, we are a couple in our forties looking for a pleasant couple of days away. Hotel Duquesa de Cardonais is opposite the beach and port and far enough away from Las Ramblas, although only three minutes walk to it, to avoid the hustle bustle when you've had enough. The roof terrace with the fantastic view and plunge pool is very pleasant with food and drink service available. We booked a sea facing room on the 5th floor, good choice, I think the other rooms look over a courtyard. We stayed in a differnet hotel the first night at the other end of the strip which was ok ish and charged 110 euros per room but felt more like someone's house we were staying in. For the extra 30 or 40 euros per night there was no comparisson to the Hotel Duquesa de Cardona, it was like a breath of fresh air after a dissapointing beginning. Just a note to anyone that hasn't been or booked to Barcelona before, book with Easyjet to Barcelona Airport NOT Ryaniar who will tell you that Rues or Reus is the Barcelona airport, well this is as true as London Luton isn't in London! We were dumped 100 km the other side of barcelona with either a taxi journey at 150 euros each way or a 2 hour bus journey for 12 euros each, just what you don't need on a short trip, out travel time ended up at 8 hours each way! Barcelona is huge and unless you do your homework it's easy to miss out on the beautiful buildings and sites. Las Ramblas was a complete let down. My opinion is don't bother with it unless you're into fast food and same shops every 100 yards. We found it a bit un-nerving, to say the least, at night in the side roads leading of it. Walking towards the sea from the hotel you'll come across a few modern Moroccan style restaurants/bars and a beautiful view, much nicer! We ate in a restaurant called SEDNA (spanish restaurant ) which is just to the right of the hotel as you look at it, totally recommend it, very nice atmosphere, friendly staff, good honest food. Happy Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable experience, one of the best hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: UrsulaKKK
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel to treat me for our anniversary, and what a discovery!! It is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed, no doubt, a hidden gem. All the staff made it so special that I would never forget it, waiters and receptionist couldn't be more helpful. We stayed in a spacious suite vey nicely decorated, the maid put a special detail for us in our my room every day, truffes with champange one day, olive candles and a basket of fruits. The terrace has amazing views of the harbour, the waiter said they are opening soon the terrace service for tapas. Definitely we will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: cinnamonhot
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon for 8 nights. We paid well over 200 euros per night. Location is great. Housekeeping is very poor. They only made the bed, but didn't bother to restock toilet paper, dust the tables, night stand, tv stand, etc for days, so much that I was tempted to do it myself!... You could write your name on the dust. They come around 6 pm to give you a card with tomorrow's weather forecast and a piece of chocolate, but after we complained that service was totally gone. Coincidence? Not sure, but it did not feel like a place that you'd want to pay over 200 euros a night. The reception staff made every effort not to make eye contact, let alone greeting you as you come and go. Bar staff was surprisingly nice, though. It's right by the main road across from marina, so the street noise is there all the time. Non-stop ambulance sirens wake you up several times a night. I could not wait to get back home, and I am the type of person who likes travelling. A lot! In general I didn't find Spanish people very welcoming. They take your business for granted and do bare minimum. Needless to say, I'm not going back to Spain. So many other places in the world to be explored.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: jgcbdsgte
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my wife for a weekend and had a great time. The location in front of Port Vell meant that in was only 3 to 4 minutes walking to the bottom of the Ramblas and 10 minutes to the beach. The reception was spotless and the staff we spoke to all spoke good english and were extremely helpful. The room was clean and functional for us, its not up to the Arts but everything you needed was there. The roof terrace is a great place to sit in the sun with a book and a drink and with a late evening flight home was a perfect for us. Stayed B&B, the breakfast was more continental but had a good choice of cereals, cold cheeses, meats etc. We would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Theft, not satisfied with hotel's reaction, taxi scam...”
Reviews.Author: APS7
Reviews.Content: I generally try and be positive about travel and have never written a negative review here but I feel that it is fair. The location of this hotel and the room were good but here are the issues: Booking was a hassle as I e-mailed back and forth with some confusion on their part as to the room we wanted and the rate quoted. It was fine eventually, we got a deluxe room on the 5th floor facing the front. However, three nights into our stay, I noticed my mobile phone missing and told the reception that it was gone. I never took the phone out with me and never used it so it was always in the room. It really could not have been lost or stolen when we were out... But I did not want to be accusatory right up, so I did not say "the maid stole my phone". But I did tell them it was missing from my room, could they please let me know if they hear anything. At checkout time, I also noticed the case for my camera missing. I don't know why anyone would take that but there you go... Maybe they wanted a case for their new mobile phone... Anyway I told them in addition to my phone another item was missing from my room. The receptionist told me the note left on my account said I had lost my phone somewhere in the hotel and they'd asked all housekeeping staff and noone had seen it. I said well I did not misplace it, it was in my room. At this point the receptionist panicked and started being quite emotional, telling me I should have told them it was stolen. Perhaps it was a nuance in English that was lost on the Spanish speakers - apparently I should have used the word "stolen" but I thought it was clear. Now that it was established that my phone was stolen, what did they do? Did they try and apologize? Try and compensate me in some way? I am afraid not. The receptionist kept talking anf talking in a loud voice about how I should have told them and noone has seen it. I paid my bill and left. By the time I reported my phone missing to the mobile company £80 worth of calls were made in Barcelona. Oh and like another reviewer said, there was also a problem with the taxi. When we took a taxi from the station when we arrived it cost us 5 euros. On the way back to the same place, going exactly the same way, the cost was 12 euros. The meter had been started before we got on the cab and there was also a charge per "Luggage". We had one shoulder bag each, smaller than an average carryon - I am not kidding... We did not have any time to fight with this taxi driver because we'd miss our connection to our flight. But it is very unclassy of this hotel to do this with the taxis... All in all, these experiences did not completely ruin our Barcelona trip but we definitely with a bad taste. The theft, the £80 I had to spend for their maid to make calls to her friends, as well as losing a rather expensive mobile phone, plus the taxi scam... I really feel this negative review is quite fair. I would not stay there again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality hotel, lovely situation, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaywallington
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a break out of town. It was the first hotel we found on google searching and definitely made the correct choice. Found on the Passeig de Colom, the road that runs along the marina it is in a nice location for strolls along the marina front and is only about a ten minute walk from Las ramblas. The entrance area is classy, it has a laid back but businessey feel to it. If I were an advertising exec or an investment banker (i've actually been both) I'd feel comfortable staying here. It has a certain feel to it that speaks quality in subtle tones. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The view over the marina is great. Those morons talking about the noise on the road...either don't go to a city, close the window tight or don't stay on a main road! There really wasn't much noise anyway and if you're in the room a lot then you're not holidaying properly anyway! Don't let noise be an issue to you unless you have the hearing of a bat and the restlessness of a death row inmate. Room service is expensive but what hotel in room service isn't? The roof terrace is great, pool is more of a big bath but still nice and the sun loungers are great to sit on and relax whilst watching the stars and the cruise ships sail off. In a nut shell, decent value for money but a great location and excellent, high quality interiors. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “A great port location!”
Reviews.Author: deleslie08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the start and finish of a cruise. The first one night's stay was in a room on the second floor on the street side. There was traffic noise but we were so tired from our travel that it did not keep us awake. On our return, two weeks later, we were on the second floor at the back of the hotel on the alley side. In both cases, the rooms were very nice and roomy for European standards. However, the alley side has an unusable small balcony and the noise from the neighboring bar and other bars in the area did keep us awake and continued most of the night. We would probably stay at this hotel on a return trip but would ask for a room on the small interior courtyard or higher up street side. The location is perfect for a cruise connection and adjacent to the Gothic Quarter with its easy access to Las Ramblas. The staff was very helpful and spoke very fluent English. I would warn others that the breakfast buffet is expensive at 14 Euros in the hotel for the items provided. I only had coffee our first morning and was charged for the entire buffet. There is a local restaurant with a much cheaper breakfast a couple of doors down as you exit to the left. There is also an American style bar next door that has very reasonable drink prices during happy hour. I think that they may also be a contributor to the late night noise in the alley. We followed a dinner recommendation from a previous reviewer and had dinner at the Sofra 18 Restaurant in the Gothic Quarter and enjoyed the experience very much. Just turn right out of the hotel and take the next right into the alley and it is down a couple of blocks on the left. Good food and reasonable prices. The staff guided us to the Tourist Bus ticket stand at Columbus Circle where we purchased a two day pass for a hop on hop off bus tour of town. This is a great way to get acquainted with the city and to visit tourist sites you choose for one price. The bus ticket includes ear phones for continuous information as you pass through town on the bus. Barcelona is a very clean city and if tourists take basic precautions for pick pockets and petty crime it is a great place to visit. The Port Bar next door has a sister bar in the Gothic Quarter (Travelers Bar0 where we took a free walking tour of the Quarter that was very interesting. We paid a small tip to the student who conducted the tour and enjoyed a free beer at the end!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Grover46
Reviews.Content: I looked for a Hotel for months as we went to Barcelona for a special occasion, and I definitely made the right decision! The hotel has a very relaxed air around it and the staff are very friendly and make you feel very welcome. The room was well decorated and the bed was one of the most comfortable that we have slept in! We mangaged to get a Classic room at the front with its own balcony overlooking the port which was great. The breakfast was excellent and the roof top terrace bar was excellent with great views over the port. The position of the hotel could not be better. Las Ramblas is 5 mins walk and at the back of the hotel is the Gothic quarter, which you need to walk around to appreciate. 10 mins walk in the other direction is the wonderful Barceloneta beach front. We had no issues at all and overall it is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. We are planning a return trip and we will be going back to this hotel. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here prior to joining a cruise. I have to admit that my first impression of the room wasn`t great. It was small with almost no natural light and overlooked an inner courtyard. The very helpful man on the desk offered us an upgrade for 40 euros per night to a front- facing room. I went along to have a look and loved the room, but then remembered that it was Merce festival time, and a front -facing room might be noisy. So we stuck with our small dark room which turned out to be blissfully quiet at all times of the day and night, so was probably the right call. That`s the only negative thing I have to say. The location was fantastic with loads of good restaurants nearby. The sun terrace was particularly lovely. It overlooked the harbour and made a great place to watch the Merce fireworks on the Saturday night. Then there was some gentle live music up there - a great way to accompany a glass of local wine. (There is a small pool up there too, but if you`re considering serious swimming - forget it) The people on reception were polite and helpful. They spoke near-perfect English and humoured my attempts at Spanish. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, feel at home !!”
Reviews.Author: BrittOdense_DK
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Barcelona this year , and I repeat the hotel. I was in Duquesa de Cardona in may for business, and I loved it! This time I came back to Barcelona to go on a cruise , and the location from this hotel is so good, that I decided to repeat, so here I am again!!. The hotel is near to everything ...Ramblas, harbour, Gothic Area.. , The atmosphere, although is very relaxed and comfortable. It has a fabolous terrace on the sixt floor, with one of the bests views I have ever seen from a harbour. The rooms are cosy (try a junior suite if you can, is spacious, comfortable, very sweet and quite ). If you are active people, Barcelona is full of surprises. Get informed at reception desk about day trips , for instance, to Montserrat, Sitges, etc, museums, different restaurants, etc. They will give you a good hand on it

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Duquesa de Cardona”
Reviews.Author: SamBelgium
Reviews.Content: With that many hotels in one city, and without any references it was a really hard pick. The nice website pulled us over. But we were very satisfied with our choice. Medium small Boutique Hotel, perfectly located near the marina and the ramblas. Perfect starting point to take some good walks in Barcelona. We only booked 2 nights, what was a mistake because we needed 3 nights. So we asked i've we could stay somewath longer. Unfortunately this was not possible due to the fact that the hotel was fully booked. But the last day there was apparently a 'no-show' so we could have that room. It was even more nicer then the one that we had booked. Unbelieveble big, for a city hotel. Nice cocktails from the rooftop at sunset, what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “disappointing well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: marylandtraveler
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel disappointing. The rooms were lovely—modern, spacious for this class of hotel, and adequately appointed. The hotel is on one of the largest streets in Barcelona. Our rooms faced the street and were noisy late in to the night and early morning, even though we were on the 6th floor. The rooms on the other side of the hotel were not noisy, but faced an alley. The hotel has a lovely, tiny, rooftop pool and its rooftop terrace offers a sweeping view of the marina and the city. The staff at the hotel was not as attentive or helpful as you might expect from such a hotel. The service at the rooftop tapas bar was unbearably slow, even in the middle of the day with no one else there. The front desk staff seemed to rely on Google for its knowledge of restaurants and other local attractions. While no one on the staff was actually rude, they were the least helpful of any hotel staff that we saw in Spain. Our stay here was pleasant enough, but I would try another hotel in this city that has many alternatives to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cheriko
Reviews.Content: Duquesa de Cardona is a lovely small hotel. It locates waterfront area and you can walk to Ramblas street in a few minutes, 15 minute walk brings you to Catalunya Square. Tourist bus stop is also within a walking distance. By taking metro at Barceloneta station on LIne 4, you can reach CCBI easily. You can find good sea food restaurants along the museum nearby and we enjoyed a walk to a beautiful beach which is within 20 minute walk from the hotel. Piccaso museum which is within 5 minute walk worths visiting. The lobby was furnished with lovey furniture and scent of vanilla candle welcomed us.I stayed in a wheelchair accessible room with a roll-in shower. The bathroom is big enough for me to turn round there. The room was also enough big for us. We took breakfast at the restaurant on the ground floor for 2 days. It was good. We also reccommend you to visit the terrace on the 6th floor with your books and batheing suits. The view from there was exquisite and you can enjoy fresh breeze there with some wine and food. The hotel staffs were all friendly and very helpful. They speak fluent English. They booked wheelchair adapted taxi, booked concert tickets at Catalunya music hall, booked tickets of framenco show for us and showed us good restaurants. It was also fun to go to the guitar concert at the church. At last, I have to tell that you shoud be very careful so that you would not be targeted by pick pockets. My husband had his wallet stolen in a bus on line 24 which goes to Guel park. Some men surrounded us and while one man was pretending to help me with my wheelchair to attract my husband's attention, other men stole the wallet. I strongly advice you to take a tourist bus or a taxi when you move in Brcelona and never to take a normal bus. If I have another chance to visit Barcelona, I am sureto stay at Duquesa de Cardona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: roxy01Cork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: The locationof this hote l is fantastic - just off Las Rambles. Rooms were small and noisy - we requested a room on the higher floors but could still hear all the traffic and sirens from the road below. Got very little sleep here. Also - the swimming pool is more like an oversized bath - a joke really. Other than that though the hotel is ok - decor is good and the rooftop bar was lovely. Location is the main thing here though.

Reviews.Title: “Made our weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Boom_King_87
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a more luxurious weekend break for my mum's 50th birthday present, so obviously was happy to spend a little more for extra comfort. Wasn't at all disappointed, the location was superb and I'd recommend paying the extra for a harbor view if you can - it was worth it to watch the fireworks from our balcony when spain won euro 2008...! Little extras were always well received, like daily weather report cards to help us plan the next day, and we were greeted by some lovely staff members who did everything to advise us so we could see the most of the city!! The hotel reserved the terrace bar on one evening of our stay, so to apologise for the inconvenience, we even received a free bottle of cava which was much appreciated!!! If you're anything like my mum and I, you can get around the city without paying anything for transport at all, as the food and drink in barcelona is quite costly. The city is relatively small but very hilly, so if you're not much of a walker stick to the underground!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great city.”
Reviews.Author: Dundeetravellers_8
Reviews.Content: Again you look at the previous reviews & some are raving about the hotel while others do not. In our case WE LOVED IT. 8 great days spent here.We knew from previous visits to Barcelona that the hotel was in a great location. You can catch all the tour buses only 5 minutes walk away at the Columbus Column. The Rambles is 5 minute from the hotel. You overlook the everchanging Marina & if you walk behind the hotel you go directly into the Gothic area where ther is a multitude of things to see & small places to eat. Don't eat in the TOURISTY Les Ramblas. Get out in the back streets & eat there. Therefore the hotel was ideal for our needs. The room was immaculate & well kept & the staff were always polite & helpful. When asked they could not do enough for you. The view from the top of the hotel is superb & if you just want a lazy day then just sit up there & watch the cars & boats go by while taking the odd dip in the splash pool. We never ate in the hotel so I cannot comment on the food, but for a cheap & cheary late breakfast the Flore De La Notre just to the left of the hotel was 1st rate. The staff there were always friendly & the service superb. On our way home from sight seeing each day we stopped in for a wee PIT STOP. That involved 2 beers/wines & an assortment of Tapas & some friendly banter with Rod the waiter. That set us up for going out at 9pm for something to eat in the Gothic area. TOP RATE HOTEL & Sorroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend break”
Reviews.Author: KymH
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. We travelled here with friends in February celebrating a 40th birthday. The weather was great too, although it started to get a little chilly around 4.00 pm and when travelling on the open top bus, but walking around during the day the sun was warm and very pleasant. We were located on the front of the hotel with a very spacious room and huge bathroom. We were worried that it might be noisy as there was a fairly busy road out to the front, however, we were pleasantly surprised. Whilst the road was fairly busy during the day, at night there was little traffic around. Beyond the road was the Port which we could just see through the trees. Our friends had rooms to the rear of the building whilst smaller with no real views, just looking out onto narrow streets with buildings directly opposite, these were very quiet and, although small, were satisfactory. There's a lovely rooftop terrace with plunge pool, sunbeds, bar and views across to the Port. Although the bar on the rooftop wasn't open when we were there, the waiters were more than happy to bring up drinks for us. The staff were pleasant and the hotel was clean. The hotel is in a good location, we were a five minute walk to the beach and in the other direction to Columbus' column. We were also on the famous bus route so we could choose from various stops to get on to the bus. Great hotel, good location, what more could you ask for. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely go back. Lots of places to eat - you can choose from around the Port area - where there are lots of fish restaurants, or walk through the narrow streets into the main town. Recommeded things to do: Try at least one, if not all three, of the bus routes - ticket office at Columbus' Column. There are various options - we did a 2 day ticket for two routes (blue and red, as the green bus does not run in the winter months). You can get on and off as many times as you want and they run every 10-15 minutes so you never have to wait long before another bus arrives. Visited Gaudi's cathedral - a tip for you go to the queue at the rear tower lift as this is much shorter - we queued up for 2 hours to go up the first lift not realising there was a second at the rear! You go up by lift but come down by stairs and there are lots of them so be warned! Don't miss Parc Guell - we had a great afternoon there, but you could spend a whole day there wandering around. Great views too. Definitely worth a visit. The Olympic Stadium and Nou Camp also worth a visit. We were lucky enough to see some of the Team arrive at the Nou Camp when we were there. Wasn't impressed by the Ramblas - very busy but nothing much of interest. Probably want to go to say you've been but other than that don't worry if you miss it - there are better things to see. And, of course, Gaudi's houses - we didn't go in, but will do next time! Great place to go - don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Benino
Reviews.Content: The building and rooms are beautiful. The staff was barely pleasant. Did not offer assistance unless asked then answered our questions sparingly, without offering any additional advise or ideas. Also of importance, upon departure we realized that two bags of souvenir items (food and knicknacks) were missing (which we didn't bother reporting since we listened to another guests' complaint of missing items and the staff response).

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: dtm17
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fabulous spot! We stayed three nights and then moved to another hotel because the Duquesa was booked for the weekend. What a difference! If you visit Barcelona (and you really should!) this is where you want to be. The hotel staff could not be friendlier. The rooms, while small by American standards, could not be lovelier. And the location is perfect. Walk to the best of everything (with the exception of a few spots -- more about that later). The view from the rooftop terrace is breathtaking; the terrace itself changes the whole vacation. It provides a wonderful, relaxing place to be outside! Bring your book, order a drink and enjoy one of most beautiful cities on this planet. Recommendations: You can walk to Las Ramblas, the Maritime Museum, the basilica of Santa Maria del Mar, the Olympic port, Port Vell, the Picasso Museum, the Gothic Cathedral, a gazillion plazas and tapas bars, etc, etc. See what I mean about location! Take the Bus Turistic to visit Parc Gueill, Sagrada Familia and Montjuic. Eat at The 4 Cats! Enjoy Barcelona and enjoy this hotel... we did!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Dashkina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the exhibition in CCIB that we were a part of. Staying previously on Avenguida Diagonal, we've decided to choose a more central location, even though it would mean a taxi drive to the venue. And we were so right! The hotel is located right on the sea with a beautiful view on the harbor. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, just walked a couple of blocks, got some coffee and snacks and went to the pier. It is just a 5 minutes walk to Rambla, and 5-10 minutes to any place in the gothic part of the downtown. I had a standard room, and it was pretty dark, as there was just a small window facing the inner yard. But the rate we've got was pretty good for a 4* hotel (about 130 euros), so no complaints. The reception staff was very nice and helpful. The roof terrace and sun deck are very nice. I've ordered food there and it was average, but the sunset and sea in front of you makes it up. I would be happy to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: chinagirlAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I did stay in this very good hotel in Januar. I asked for a room with harbourview and got one. Everything in the room and the bathroom, which were both very well-sized, was tip-top; Nice style, good materials, comfortable. Real four-stars luxe. The people at the desk were very friendly and helpfull. And of course the roofterrace is marvellous to relax on. Many nice neighbourhoods on walkingdistance. E.g.the Born is next door, with a lot of good places to eat and drink. And very nice as well: The low prices in Januar, when there are already much sunshine and good temperatures in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: CraigJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in November - very pleased with our stay - staff very friendly and professional - spoke English surprisingly well - property well maintained - rooms very clean and well appointed - location excellent as it's only a couple of blocks from Las Ramblas and on the edge of the old town and harbour - the only issue is that the hotel is on a very busy street and there is a some street noise - if you're expecting lots of quiet ask for a room facing the court yard or back of the hotel - we faced the water/street and there was some noise but not really a problem - I'd stay here again and would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to the start of a cruise and were very happy with our choice. The staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. Our room looked out over the front and despite the proximity to the road, it was relatively quiet. The room wasn’t huge but was well appointed with a good bathroom and nice toiletries. Our only slight criticism was the bed which was rather soft, but then better than a lot of the very hard beds we’ve slept on in numerous Spanish hotels. We didn’t make use of the pool or restaurants but what we saw of the public rooms they were very attractive. Having stayed at three other hotels in Barcelona between Sept and November 2007, this was by far our best experience. The excellent location close to the water front, Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter (and therefore lots of restaurants nearby) make it a good choice. We will certainly try to book it again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pablogogo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an excellent location right on the harbour and within a stones throw of the Gothic Quarter and Las Ramblas. The nearby Drassanes metro station, 2min walk, is very handy and the metro is certainly one of the cleanest I have ever been on. The tourist bus is handy however I found it annoying that it only runs in one direction. Personally I like the metro or to use my feet. I would agree with a previous review and advise you to leave out the do not disturb sign as staff can enter the room, and I also found that a bit weird. The hotel is extremely quiet and well sound proofed, no street noise. The roof terrace has a great view of the city, we did not try the pool as it was December and it was very cold there at that time. You get what you pay for with an extremely clean room of a high quality standard and the bathrooms are spotless, they are quiet roomy too, the bath is a nice feature too over a shower as you can have a nice relaxing bath after a day of walking. For breakfast I would recommend skipping the €14 breakfast (€17 for in room), which is nice, at the hotel and grab some freshly baked local food in a store one street behind the hotel and about three blocks towards Las Ramblas. (Apologies for not know the exact address but if you follow your nose you will find it.) A good restaurant for mid day food would have to be Boga restaurant on Carrer Ample, more or less directly behind the hotel, reasonably priced, good service and nice atmosphere. One thing not miss while in Barcelona has to be the Magic Fountain, check the show times to ensure you get to see it with the music on as well as it runs at night time, great fun. I have talked to so many people and they don't know about it, its certainly is worth a visit. Also a visit to the aquarium is excellent too, the info signs in the aquarium are in English too which is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: CACoastTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a cruise and picked this hotel due to it's proximity to the cruise terminal. We had a lovely view of the harbor and it's an easy walk to Las Ramblas, and a moderate walk to the Chocolate Museum and the Picasso museum (which mid-week mid-school term still had a line of over an hour each time we walked past). The hotel was very friendly to us as language challenged American Tourists. They happily exchanged money orders for us at better than bank rates and pointed out the very convenient nearby stop for city bus tours. While we were not honeymooning, it was a lovely location and we'll remember it more favorably than the significantly more expensive hotels around London that we stayed at prior to our Barcelona arrival. Restaurant hours were not favorable for us but it was a short walk to numerous locations. Internet access was no charge (surprisingly) but there was only 1 terminal for guests to use. Note - it's a bit of a walk to anywhere - if you are not up to that, be prepared to get taxi's to go much of anywhere. The taxi fares were reasonable from the airport and inexpensive for local short trips. It's NOT a resort hotel by my definition, and with the limited access to food, internet, and other exercise facilities in the hotel, I can't give it an 'excellent' mark. But it was an excellent choice for our needs and I'd book there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Situation”
Reviews.Author: PeterNJ
Reviews.Content: A stay of four nights in mid-September 2007. Fittings, cleanliness etc of room and bathroom were as one would expect of a 4* hotel. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was ample but one should ask for whatever one wants,e.g. freshly cooked eggs. Cheaper rooms have a narrow window looking into central well, therefore the higher floors have more light. One of the few hotels in Barcelona with an open aspect. It faces the marina with Barceloneta beyond. Gothic Quarter, Born, the beaches are all within easy reach either on foot or by bus. Biggest asset is situation overlooking entire harbour from roof terrace equiped with small pool, loungers, towels, shower, chairs, sun umbrellas and bar. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: AmyEade
Reviews.Content: Lovely chilled hotel in a perfect position. Brillant views, nice terrace with pool (staff will bring wine to poolside if the bar upstairs isn't open). Very resonably priced for what you get. I've been to Barcelona before and this was much, much better. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Duequesa de Cardona Hotel and Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn_NJ1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from Visiting Barcelona,Spain and stayed at this lovely boutique hotel - outstanding service and location. Quiet hotel with panaromic rooftop views of the Seaport (located in Gothic area - Port Vell). Perfect location - within walking to the seaport and all restaurants on the seaport - Ramblas was right in back of us. Mario at Hotel helped us with sightseeing attractions (buy a 2 day bus pass - comes with headset to hear about all the sites you are seeing). Buses run every 5 minutes and the only way to see the beautiful architecture Barcelona has to offer. We stayed only 2 days and then took a cruise of the Meditteranean out of Barcelona thru Italy and Nice France.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely faultless”
Reviews.Author: gob2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a midweek break in May and had an absolutely brilliant time. Really lovely, quiet, luxury hotel - fantastic staff, great food and service. Superb location. Try the rooftop terrace for breakfast and - be brave! - take a dip in the very cold pool!

Reviews.Title: “If you can stay here”
Reviews.Author: RaymondsofWoking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely - the staff were excellent and we will definitely go back. Read some not so good reviews about breakfast - yes it was a bit expensive at 14 euros each but there was a lot of choice and the restaurant was beautiful - so we treated ourselves on the last day as the breakfasts in some of the local cafes were not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mickeym0use
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second leg of our honeymoon. We loved this hotel. It felt like a giant and elegant bed and breakfast. The staff was very professional. The breakfast was yummy, which was included. It is a small hotel where you felt like you started to know the other patrons. The pool bar area was nice, with an amazing view of Barcelona. The location was amazing- close to the Ramblas (great street where there are outside cafes and street performers), El Born, the boats and Barcelonetta( beach). The room in the hotel was very nice. The hotel was clean and very personal. We loved our stay. We walked around a lot and went to places where the locals went to.If you have the time, go to Monserrat- breathtaking views and adventure (about an hour or so away from Barcelona on the underground and then the train). We loved the hotel and Barcelona and would love to come back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Carly de Cardona”
Reviews.Author: carleeanne
Reviews.Content: After much debate my boyfriend and I decided to stay at this hotel after reading the reviews that it had recieved and were not disappointed! On arrival the member of staff who checked us in was friendly and spoke excellent English, as did all of them, and we were allocated room 10, on the first floor, which overlooked the main promenade and harbour. This made for beautiful views, however it was very noisy, as can only be expected in cities, and we were awoken by sirens on a number of occasions. The room was spacious and the bathroom was extremely clean and modern. They were cleaned around mid-day every day and we were given chocolates and weather forecasts for the following day in the evening! The only complaint I had about the room was that the bed was two singles pushed together, which kind of killed the romance a little as we were under separate sheets! In the morning our breakfasts were agreeable, with a choice of fruit, bread, cheeses, meats, pastries, cereals in boxes, fried egg on toast, small sausages and thin streaky bacon. Not to be grumbled at but definately not the 'Hot Buffet Breakfast' that we were expecting! And we couldn't fathom how to use the toaster! The location is superb, with La Rambla being 5 minutes away, the Catheral and Picasso Museum (which had a queue a mile long) only 10 to 15 mintues away, and the City Park only 15 to 20 minutes away, which features a superb zoo! Even then we still had a few taxis as they were so cheap, though we found that many supplements were added for unknown reasons! The terrace is simply divine and it is worth staying here simply for the views that you get of the whole of Barcelona while sitting in the pool. On our first day we had the terrace all to ourselves which made for a romantic dip in the pool! The pool's about 3 foot deep and not very long or wide, however it is more than adequate. It's also quite cool, which was perfect for cooling off in after walking around the city all day, however my boyfriend was less than impressed! As a final note, everywhere you look there is beautiful architecture, even down the back streets and a meal at the Hard Rock Cafe is a must! I hope this was useful to you and please feel free to contact me regarding this review.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: luckyderosa
Reviews.Content: finished my european trip at the D/C. great stay! location, location-get a room on 5th floor facing port- more $ but the view is worth it! the staff *naomi, marta, mario* were very kind and helpful. the beds are extremely comfortable and you get to choose your type of pillow!!!! best of all the a/c is first rate- which you need because barcelona is hot, hot, hot. take the tourist bus- 2 blocks away to get around the city to give yourself an idea what you really want to spend time visiting- get to piccaso musee early- long line. i highly rate this hotel.by the way 100's of cabs on street at all times.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shark67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Duquesa de Cardona hotel in Barcelona. This was a lovely hotel and the best we have stayed in so far in Barcelona. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from La Rambla and about a 5 minute walk from the beach so you have the best of both worlds in terms of location. There is a roof top terrace with views out over the port where you can escape and watch the world going by with a nice glass of wine. The rooms were kept very clean and the staff are very friendly and always provided positive advise and information, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Must go again”
Reviews.Author: mlambert
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short but sweet. I ended up choosing this hotel based on the reviews on this website and I was not let down at all. My girlfirend and I stayed here for three nights in March and had a fabulous stay. Location was brilliant and most things were a short walk away. Connections wise for further trips was easy. We had a great time and the staff were extremely helpful. the buffet breakfast set us up for the day but we didn't eat dinner there. All in all, would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except for...”
Reviews.Author: dictionary1
Reviews.Content: Location: great. Rooms: good- smallish but nicely appointed and fairly quiet. The problem? DO NOT allow the staff to call you a taxi. For one, you can just walk out front and catch one any time of day. If you do, watch the driver come in and hand the front desk person a 5 euro note. Then, the driver takes you the scenic route to make it back. And, you waste 10 mins waiting. We booked a restaurant reservation at La Venta- which is a neat restaurant with a view of all of Barcelona and away from the tourist traps- the front desk and the taxi driver warned me it was 'very far'. And on the way there, it was- to the tune of 30 euros. When we caught a cab off the street to return to the hotel we were back in 1/2 the time and for 12 euros. Be warned- it was a small detail but enough to create mistrust of the seemingly nice hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Duquesa for 4 nights. Highly recommended hotel! It’s in a beautiful, old part of the city, the Barri Gotic neighborhood, a lively, picturesque area with a wide variety of restaurants, bars, cafés, shops, and little plazas. The Duquesa is on the Passeig Colom which is along the waterfront and intersects the south end of the Ramblas, a short walk away. The Duquesa is easy to get to from the airport, simply take the RENFE train all the way to it’s terminus, the Estacio de Franca. From the station, walk along the Passeig Colom for about 3 blocks to the Duquesa. Real easy especially if you don’t have much luggage. To get to other parts of Barcelona, there is a subway station about 4 blocks away and taxis are easy to get in front of the hotel. The Duquesa is in a beautiful old former palace, it has an intimate but airy, and welcoming lobby. I was given a room (#28) on the backside of the hotel, it has a cute little balcony overlooking a small passageway/alley. The room itself has extra high ceilings, is spacious, just the right size for a couple. It has a nice mix of contemporary and traditional décor, but all the amenities are modern, well-maintained and everything works well. There’s both a shower stall and a bathtub. The bed and pillows are quite comfortable, towels plush. There’s wireless internet access but it wasn’t very easy to connect to, I gave up trying after a several attempts. There is, for free, one computer with internet access and a printer in the “business center” but it’s really just a little corner off a hallway. The staff is friendly, helpful, and very professional. They are very discreet yet readily available when you need them. Overall, the Duquesa is a great choice for its location, value for the money, amenities, service, ambiance, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKCHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Duquesa de Cardona in Oct. 2006 for three nights. The hotel is very nicely appointed- the common spaces are well-decorated and pretty and everything is clean. The location was great. Within a few minutes walk we were in the heart of the Gothic Quarter or on La Rambla. The Cathedral of Barcelona and numerous other sites are in close proximity to Duquesa de Cardona. The street the hotel is on is very pretty with wide sidewalks and palm trees; the view of the water is also lovely. We enjoyed drinks on the rooftop terrace one night, which was fun. The rooms were not terribly large, but they were nice looking with a pretty bathroom. A friend of ours who lives in Barcelona got a corporate rate for us by booking the hotel through his company, so I can't speak to how great a value Duquesa is. I will say, however, that the location is terrific and it is a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Barceloma”
Reviews.Author: RJS123
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the best located hotel in Barcelona - right in front of the Gothic Quarter, and only 5 minutes walk to La Ramblas (just far enough away). Also, right on the harbour front which is ideal for restaurants and shopping. Room and service were excellent and highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GailMontrose
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Duquesa de Cardona was the best place we stayed on our Feb-March trip to Spain. We had a room overlooking the port and within easy walking distance of almost everything. The portside avenue is busy, but with the windows closed, we were not bothered by noise; and with the windows open we had an impressive view. The staff was gracious and helpful. Our room was modestly sized but very well appointed. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: dantescraps2007
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an excellent trip! We were thoroughly impressed with the hotel and the staff. When we started the process of looking through hotels in Barcelona, we relied heavily on Trip Advisor, and it paid off. The location for this hotel is excellent. It is right on the harbor directly across from the Aquarium, and very, very close to the Barceloneta district, the Born district, and the Gothic quarter. As we read in other reviews, we sprung for the external balcony room on the 5th floor and it was TOTALLY worth the upgrade. The views of the sunrise every morning were breathtaking. Now, if you are not from a metropolitan area, the balcony rooms are definitely exposed to traffice noise, but nothing that will keep you awake. The balcony doors are actually pretty sound-proof. If you're used to city noise, this is nothing out of the ordinary. The room itself was quite large by European standards and the bed was as well, and didn't have that crease in the middle so common in Europe. The bathroom was spacious and clean. Now, other reviews said that there were no doors on the shower. The fact is that the showers have a very modern partial shield, but because the showerhead is a moveable, handheld massage head, you don't have to worry about getting water all over the place. The rooftop veranda was also wonderful. There is a tiny dunking pool there that was very clean, but it was a little too cold weatherwise to partake. However, it offers amazing views of the harbor and is a great place to sip a glass of rioja and read. I can imagine in the summer it would be a phenomenal place to catch some sun. The staff was amazingly friendly and accomodating. Our room was not ready when we arrived early at the hotel, so, because, it is the off-season, they immediately moved us into a ready room so we could shower and unpack after our long flight. They gave great recommendations for restaurants and tapas places. They also were great in telling us just about the history of the hotel and getting us transportation whenever we needed it. On an un-hotel-related note, be sure to check out the Basque tapas places-the Frommers and Streetwise guides don't tell you about these specifically. At most tapas places, you order from a menu for a plate of a particular dish. At a Basque place, it's usually standing only with 20 or so dishes on a long counter. You can take as many or as few of each one as you want. Just ask for a plate and grab them toothpick by toothpick. When you're done, the waiters count your number of used toothpicks and charge you per item. These tapas plus a glass of cava hit the spot! One great place for tapas and a sit-down meal is Art, near the Santa Maria del Mar. As long as you're there, be sure to check out the wine bar, El Vinyo del Senyor directly across from the church. Excellent, especially at night when you can sit outside and people watch. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so we can't comment on that. But if you don't want to pay 14 Euro for buffet and want a more local experience, try the public markets. For about 6 Euro apiece, you can get bocatas (breakfast sandwiches) or eggs with bacon and fresh oj. Excellent! Plus, you'll see all the locals which is spectacular. All in all, we had an absolutely FABULOUS trip! Be sure to book this hotel; it's a vacation in itself! We would definitely stay there again! On another non-hotel note, be careful if booking flights through Expedia. They booked us on Air France through Paris, connecting to Barcelona. Air France also had its issues, because each of our 4 flights left late and we missed our connections both coming and going because of this. We found out from Air France it was because Expedia booked us on connections with only a 50 minute layover, which is physically impossible to make at Charles DeGaulle Airport, given that you have to go through passport validation, then security, then get to your gate where you have to take a bus to your plane. We called Expedia before our return trip to try to switch to a later connecting flight after we found out from Air France that our current Expedia booking would likely result in another missed transfer. We were on the phone with Expedia on an international call for 45 minutes, only 7 of which did we actually speak to a person. When we asked to switch the time of our connection, they wanted to charge us $200 apiece to rebook. We asked why we would have to pay since the short layover times were their mistake (Expedia is in the travel business so shouldn't they know 50 minutes is impossible at that airport?). Their response was, "Well, everyone has to be accountable." When we refused to pay, they wouldn't help us at all. As predicted, we missed our connecting flight when the Barcelona flight landed late in Paris. I guess we were accountable in the sense that we were foolish enough to trust Expedia to book us properly in the first place. SO, lesson to be learned, make sure you have AT LEAST 90 minutes between connections going through Charles DeGaulle and don't let Expedia tell you any differently.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Supercalfragalistic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Barcelona after staying at this hotel for 4 nights. On arrival at the hotel our room (number 43 following recommendations on this site) was not ready as we had arrived early. The receptionist was incredibly helpful and friendly and arranged for Mario (concierge) to place our bags in storage until our room was ready. The receptionist then asked if we would like to have a coffee at the hotel or if we would like to take a wander. After deciding the latter he then gave us a map and showed us where we could get a coffee locally and also pointed out some of the other sights within close proximity. On return to the hotel we were taken to our room by Mario who carried our bags and when we entered the room found that there were flowers and chocolates waiting (arranged by my husband and the travel agent) and a bottle of wine courtesy of our travel agent. I have since found out that this was very difficult to organise but the hotel did all they could to help. On our first night 2 cards were put through our door; 1 with a Good Night note and a weather forecast for the following day and 1 with a menu for you to select a fragrance for your room the following day! Oh and 2 chocolates as well! They even have a pillow menu by the bed where you can choose your type of pillow. Everything else about the hotel was wonderful, a great selection at breakfast and everything was replenished regularly (contrary to other reviews on this site), rooms were clean and stylishly decorated. The hotel is well positioned for everything in the city if you want to escape the hustle and bustle. Numerous restaurants are well witihin a short walking distance. The hotel does reccomend one restaurant 'Agut' which we did not like and would favour El Salon much more highly. Also there is a great tapas bar just round the corner for lunch called Carabello offers 'Champagn' (Cava) and Tapas stood up at the bar like the locals. Plates of succulent Octopus in paprika and fried pimientos (peppers) and 5 glasses of cava came to only 15 euros! One thing worth noting is that the drinks on La Ramblas are very expensive - be warned!! On our last day Mario again looked after our bags whilst we ambled around the city and then on our return waited outside for us to hail a taxi to take us to the airport. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Not sure if room 43 is any better than any other but definately ask for a Harbour Room view. On the first floor you get a larger balcony but you are closer to street level and as such may be subject to higher noise levels. Overall, a wonderful experience that even the most discerning of traveller will struggle to criticise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rhldevon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Duquesa de Cardona is a C19 building on the palm-fronted waterfront boulevard overlooking the yacht marina near the heart of the Gothic centre of Barcelona. Well situated near the port , but on a busy road with some noise from the traffic. Our room was on the front with a balcony overlooking the marina. It was quite small but comfortable and well appointed. The hotel has a rooftop terrace with a lovely view over the waterfront and with a small pool. Lunches can be served here at extra cost. The hotel's dining room did not serve evening meals so we asked the concierge for a recommendation. As most restaurants in Barcelona do not open until 8 pm and we prefer to eat earlier, he suggested the Restaurant 7 Portes, five minutes walk away. It is open all day and is a Barcelona institution founded in 1836. The food was good and we dined there several times.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mn3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was magnificent, in a brilliant location (right by the water, las ramblas and about 15 mins walk from beach) and spotless inside. The pool was quite small and always very busy but the views were spectacular. There was a lovely sun deck which made it tempting to soak up the sun rather than sight see, especially as there was a food and drink service! The room was lovely, it can be a tiny bit noisy if you are at the back of the hotel at the weekend but it gives you an excuse to stay out late! Overall it was a fabulous stay, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ejan
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel after the cruise it was too early for check-in, but the hotel was very accomodating about securing our luggage until late in the afternoon. They also provided us with a map of the area and answered our question (in perfect Engligh) about what we should see in the area. Unfortunately after our first night stay, a medical problem developed and the staff went out of their way to help us in any way they could, including an early departure. (We stayed 2 nights out of 3.) The hotel was conveniently located for the bus touristic, the Picasso Museum, and for restaurants nearby. I'd strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hywel
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel in the centre of Barcelona. It is on the edge of the old town and has an amazing terrace with a great view over the marina and port. The pool is rather small a bit like a large bath rather than a swimming pool, but there are tables and chairs together with loungers, although as it was November we did not use them. The rooms are a good size and air conditioned if it gets too hot. We were lucky to have a room with a view over the Passeig de Colom, which we did not find too noisy unlike some other reviewers. The en suite bathrooms are large and the shower was very good. The breakfast was included in our room booking (14 Euros usually) and was a continental buffet style. We thought that it was a good selection with cold meats, cheeses, bread, fresh fruit, freshly squeezed fruit juices, various pastries and some traditional Spanish touches as well. The best feature however was the friendly staff. They could not do enough for you. An another touch that was a first for us was a card that they sent round the night before telling you what the weather forecast for the next day was meant to be, tehy even gave you a choice of air freshener that the housekeeping staff could offer. We have already recommended this hotel several times and have only been back two days!

Reviews.Title: “Chicagoans happy w/Duquesa”
Reviews.Author: Chicagobdaygal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days @ the Duquesa a couple of weeks ago and we had an enjoyable stay. We arrived super early and the hotel allowed us to check in before noon! Room is a decent size but doesn't have much storage/closet space. Bathroom is huge but like hotel in Madrid shower door covers only 1/2 of shower, also shower head moved and we flooded the bathroom floor twice. Very clean, prompt service. We had room 43 facing the main street Calle de Colom - bar next door only noisey during our Fri night stay. Hotel very close to Las Ramblas and it's possible to walk (long walk) to most attractions. Little deli across from PapaBubble (candy maker) on Amble had great little sandwhiches. We felt pretty safe in Gothic district (except for the really small/dark streets). Would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kayla_0001
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a 4 night stay, we thoroughly enjoyed all 4 nights within the hotel. The hotel staff are very helpfull and friendly and the atmosphere in the hotel is perfect for peace and quiet. We did not include breakfast in our booking which from reading other reviews was a good thing, we did however have breakfast room service one morning which we found was overpriced for what is was, however was a delicious treat! The hotel is situated in a lovely spot, close walk to all popular attractions especially La Rambla, the marina lays right outside and is lovely to walk around, particularly when the sun shines. We had a room without a view at the back which we found to be lovely and quiet although looked onto a window but with black out curtains it suited us fine. Unfortunately due to bad weather our stay wasn't pefect but the hotel (and company) made it extremely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience if you are American.”
Reviews.Author: Count of Monte Crisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days before our cruise. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but there were a few downsides, many of which have been mentioned in previous reviews. Good points: Desk staff very polite and helpful. Called for extra towels and they arrived within minutes. The bathroom was huge, clean and beautiful. The shower had tons of water pressure and hot water. The bed was large and comfortable. Air conditioning worked well. Room and bath was very clean. Less than good points: Room was very small by American standards. Overlooked a cruddy, noisy back street. The noise was very bad until the bars close. The window did not close/seal tightly, which added to the noise level. Sad looking breakfast for 14 euros. Overall, I think if we were going to stay for a longer time, we would look for something different or upgrade to a larger room overlooking the main street. The location is excellent, within walking distance of many things to see and do. The small size of the room was somewhat offset by the high ceilings and the marvelous bathroom. There was one strange thing about the design of the shower...there was no shower curtain or door. Taking a shower basically floods the bathroom. We stayed in room 26.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Gem”
Reviews.Author: Anna1410
Reviews.Content: In the heat of Barcelona and the noise of the bustling city, this lovely little hotel was pure heaven, set right on the front of Port Vell, only 10 minutes from the beach, Las Ramblas and the Barri Gottic district, you really couldn't wish for a better location. Polite staff, peaceful surroundings, cool settings, pool deck on the top floor to cool off in the hot afternoons. I have to say that this hotel made our stay near perfect. We will definately go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArdMhacha
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel - excellent location, beside the Ramblas and Port and the Barri gothic quarter. The only problem is that if you go for a sea view the noise of the road is very high.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - booked from Trip Advisor recommendations”
Reviews.Author: starfish2005
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at this lovely hotel. Good location - turn left at the end of Las Ramblas and walk for about 5 minutes and it's on your left hand side. Good sized room. Excellent air-con / heating. Roof terrace would be great in the summer. The staff on reception were really helpful and made phone calls to sort out a ticket collection issue we had for a concert. Brilliant seafood restaurant on the port. Turn left out of the hotel and walk to the next big junction. Cross over the road towards the sea and in the large building in front of you at the end there is a great restaurant - we showed up at 10.30 on Saturday night and they fitted us in. Good food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: timmytwoshoes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Duquesa de Cardonda for 2 nights with my son for a pre xmass break. Very pleased with the hotel and staff . Well worth the cost. Only 2 faults (in our eyes) No tea/coffee making in rooms. My room at the rear left hand side (47) over looked an ally way with a late night bar ,very loud at 1am. but what do you expect in a city centre. will re visit but pay extrea for a seaview room
